Reviews.Title: “This place has slipped a LOT since August 2011.....”
Reviews.Author: NyTravelinMan14
Reviews.Content: I stay at this location for the convenience to the Las Vegas Convention Center South building for trade shows. This will be my last stay there. It was VERY disappointing. I was in the room 3 minutes, went to slide the bathroom door open and the handle fell off in my hand! The carpet has stains all over it, looking very dirty. I asked for an in room fridge like I had last stay. I was told they would see what they could do. They never responded back. There is a "cooler" in the room that looks like a fridge, but it barely cools water. Its not meant for food. The housekeeping staff is terrible. I had to keep calling the desk for bars of soap and shampoo when they were low/out because it was never refilled. this happened 3 times in the 8 days I was there. The same for the in room coffee. I had to call daily. I KNOW the carpet was not vacuumed, because things on the floor when I went out in the morning were still there at night upon my return. As a Silver member, I am supposed to get a newspaper at my door daily. I got it two days, even after complaining. The restaurant slipped downward as well...see separate review. The shower head was mediocre and no longer adjustable. The two pluses are the very comfortable bedding and nice bath towels.

Reviews.Title: “viva la reniassance”
Reviews.Author: Andilyn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for business trips, directly across the street from the convention center. Staff was okay, one concierge was super helpful, the other one not so much. Good drinks, food and the pool's nice but only gets sun til around 3pm. Very quiet. Easy tram ride to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Djmfried
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 23-25 Check In: Fast check in/out with professional & friendly staff Lobby: Really nice. Quite modern with separate sitting areas. Room: PERFECT! Modern, inviting and comfortable. QUIET. this is by far the most quiet hotel room I have stayed in. Bathroom was fantastic. Everything so clean and new it looks like you are the first person ever using it. Staff: Great. The Valet was quick, efficient everytime we pulled in or out. Bellman was friendly, taking time to show us the room features. Housekeeping staff was only 'glitch' in our stay. We called down for a blanket around 5pm and within 45min housekeeping knocked on door with sheets and extra pillows but no blanket. Asked about the blanket and was told they didn't have any at that time as they were in the process of being washed. Housekeeping said they would be back later with blanket so we tipped at that tipped since we were leaving for dinner. And wouldnt be in room when she returned. No blanket ever came. Honestly, this did not tarnish our stay or likely hood of returning, a simple glitch in a. Perfect experience. Location: awesome. Adjacent to the convention center. Tram depot 1minute walk. Hotel is behind Wynn/Encore off the strip and is so easy to come/go versus being directly on the strip. Recommend this hotel to everyone. This hotel is totally smoke free!

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip and thankfully no casino - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Still call Australia Home
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is a place I choose to avoid for pleasure. However it's a city I have visited on conventions more than a dozen times. I don't gamble and I dont smoke, but I do appreciate good food, wine and beer...and good service. I had two nights in Renaissance and was pleased with the standard of accommodation, amenities and the fact that I didnt have to cross the casino floor to get to my elevator and did not have to inhale 2nd hand smoke. Rooms were well appointed, comfortable and the bed was great. Adjacent to the convention center and airtram stop makes it convenient without the bustle of the strip. Sheltered pool, spa and gym looked quite appealing although I did not use it. I did use the business center and they were most helpful. I would stay here again....good for families as well as business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “"Don't tell everybody, but I am updating you to a suite"”
Reviews.Author: lorenzo r
Reviews.Content: Started bad with a poorly educated lady passing right in front of me and jumping the line at registration. I did not say anything giving the benefit of the doubt she just needed to go quick or otherwise having an accident on line .... finished oustandingly by the front desk apologizing for the unortodox lady behavior, and giving me an update to the best suite on a VIP floor with view on the strip and golf course. My room was bigger than my house, clean, and cozy. If I only would have found Pamela coming out from the walking closet in lingeries and with an inviting smile ... would have been perfect !! Just kidding honey (my wife). I love you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: corklevy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location if you don't want to/can't afford to stay on the Strip but want to be close. It is at the north end - nearest to the Bellagio/Palazzo/Wynn area. It is also right next to the convention center and the Vegas monorail for easy access to the major casinos. We ate dinner one night at Grill 55 - I thought the food was above average for this type of hotel. The reception and pool areas are very pretty and there are always cabs available to pick you up. The rooms were just OK. The bed wasn't the most comfortable and the shower curtain in our bathroom was white but obviously (and grossly) stained. You had to pay for internet access. On the nice side, there was an iPod dock in our room and the toiletries are Aveda. Priceline considered this property to be a 4.5-star hotel. It is definitely more like 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this Renaissance!!”
Reviews.Author: JulieBasurto
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay this last weekend at Renaissance Las Vegas. My husband and I had booked at another hotel. But, when we checked in to that hotel we found the room to be very dirty and unsafe. We checked out at 3 am and where in need of another hotel. We stopped at three different hotels along the way to only find out everything was sold out. Then we came to the Renaissance and they too were booked, but made room for us. We were so happy with the staff and how clean the rooms are. We will not go to another hotel in Las Vegas other then this one. We love how it doesn't smell like smoke and that it is so close to the strip. Thank you Renaissance for taking great care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service made for an incredible weekend”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I celebrated her birthday with a weekend getaway to Vegas. I wanted it to be a special weekend for her, and Ann and the staff at the Renaissance made sure that happened. I spoke with Ann before arriving and told her what ammenities I wanted for our arrival; a bottle of chardonnay, a birthday treat, etc... Ann went over and above to make sure that our room was spectacular and that everything was waiting for us when we checked in. My girlfriend was blown away. The room was amazing; very Vegas and everything was beyond what I expected. My girlfriend and I both travel for work, so we are used to Marriott's great service on most occassions, but this was beyond exceptional. The Renaissance is not on the strip and doesn't have a casino, and for us that was a huge plus. We could easily go to the strip and do all the Vegas things, but could escape from it at the Renaissance; a BIG plus for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent "non gaming" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: As a repeat guest to this hotel, very happy with my recent stay. I had a prior issue with this hotel, however this stay was top notch. The front desk staff were delighted to serve. I felt the warm welcome as a Platinum Elite. The location is perfect with the monorail next door. The non smoking atmosphere is a huge plus as well. My son and I ordered room service, it was prompt, great quality and came with a decent price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mercy J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance in Vegas this past weekend and upon arrival i was very impressed.. As we got to the room it was superb by space and cleanliness. The bathrooms were immaculate and almost felt at home.... Our stay was an enjoyable weekend and the locality to the strip and or access to the monorail was superb... A definite return will be in our future and recommendations to friends and family will be made.. Thank you for a wonderful weekend.. Mercy J

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service from Maota”
Reviews.Author: timdagg
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say that on several nights in the Renaissance bar, my colleagues and I received the most excellent service from your employee named Maota. This gentleman always had a great smile, excellent service and very attentative. You could tell that he really enjoys helping people. You have an excellent employee within your ranks and I wish more of my own employees had his attitude. This guy is AWESOME. My name is Tim Dagg. I can be reached at tim.dagg@sbcglobal.net if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch, back off the strip”
Reviews.Author: MSPilot
Reviews.Content: Instay at this hotel frequently on business. This hotel is usually quiet. Rarely has it ever been noisy from partiers. It's Vagas! The rooms are very clean, up to date. Modern. Plenty of room. Very comfy. If I was very critical, I would say they could use better quality comforters and sheets, and slightly nicer mattresses. Over all not bad though. The bar and room service food is great! Customer service is top notch! You would have to take a taxi or train to the strip several blocks away. Taxis are alway camping out in front of the hotel. Checkin parking area is a bit cramped but the bell staff is very accommodating. Regular parking is available also. There might be a charge for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great option - upscale and modern with great service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: KTnDC
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Modern -very clean -quiet -non-smoking -great service -convenient to the convention center -one of the best concierge lounges in the Marriott chain Cons: -Pool area is a little small and you have to be an exhibitionist to want to use it -Other choices are closer to The Strip, if that's you're focus

Reviews.Title: “Use the tram to get to the strip”
Reviews.Author: AussieOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is owned my Marriott chain and is very nice. It is not on the strip nor can you walk to the strip from here. However, since the hotel is right beside the Las Vegas Convention center, you can catch the tram and for $5.00 it will take you over to the strip right by the door of the MGM hotel and casino. Very nice way to travel. The hotel is 95% for business travlers. Food is very expensive and nothing close. A McDonalds is 3 blocks is all we found. The outdoor pool is 80 degrees but is inbetween meeting rooms with glass windows for the business clients so they can see you swim. Don't like that at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great room service - next to convention center”
Reviews.Author: G13e
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is a nice hotel next to the convention center. There is no casino, so the ambiance is much quieter. The rooms were OK (the bathroom could use updating and new grout in the shower). Food choices are limited. There is either a very expensive steak house, or a very limited menu selection at the cafe. The best choice for meals turns out to be room service - which was very good. The meals arrived sooner than promised and were all very good. So location, quiet hotel in Las Vegas, and room service are the draws for this hotel. It is also close to the monorail that goes to the strip, so another point for location.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hotel too far from Strip”
Reviews.Author: azulwater1
Reviews.Content: This is a contemporary hotel nice, clean & friendly staff. However, it is a bit far from the Vegas strip the monorail is a parking lot away and $5 one-way! There is no Casino in this hotel. IThis would be a nice hotel if you have events to attend to at the Convention Center since, it is right next door.And it's a good walk to the Strip if you are into a brisk walk.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute new years eve weekend stay..”
Reviews.Author: Thor G
Reviews.Content: Friday morning, Dec. 30th, I decided to take my family to Vegas. Everyone thought I was crazy and everyone told me I could not get a decent room or pay at least $300 a night on a sleezy hotel. Well, I wanted to prove family wrong and was glad I was able to do that with the help of Marriott Rewards Membership. I booked rooms at this hotel the very same day we are checking in for a little over $100 a night, that's gov't employee rate by the way. Location - 3.5 stars. About few blocks from the strip. Right next to the convention center. Few minutes walk to the monorail system, $12 for an old day pass if you prefer not to drive around town. We used this system to beat the holiday (New Years eve weekend) rush. This hotel is situated in a clean, well lit and safe neighborhood. Lobby - 4 stars. Spacious with comfortable and updated furnitures. There's a warm, open and inviting feel to it. They have a bar setup in the middle for a quick drink or bite, and a conveniet albeit expensive steakhouse restaurant in the back. There's another small cafe on the right end corner, which is again convenient yet somewhat pricey. I'm one who would pay for convenience sake so the price was not much of an issue to me. Room - 4 stars. A good size room with clean and updated furnitures, LCD TV w/ gaming system, mini fridge and etc. The bed was comfortable. Sheets top quality. Doubled curtain that keeps the room dark for those who want to sleep in. Sound proofing in our room was also adequate. The bathroom was clean and new. Our bathroom was LIKE-NEW and no molds. Plus, the shower is totally separate from the tub. We never had clogging issue here. In fact, my toddler had a bubble bath in the tub with no issues. The water drained swiftly when unplugged. The tub was shiny clean - I would not let my son have a bubble bath in a dirty tub! Parking - 5 stars. They have a complimentary valet parking. Very rare to find this kind of complimentary service in any hotel nowadays. Parking usually runs $12-$25/daily. So even if you tip the valet attendants, it's still a steal. Services - 5 stars. The host/hostess who checked us in was very friendly and professional. There was a lot of people lining up to check in but they were very efficient. They did not look frazzled considering all the guest arriving to check in all at the same time. It was the New Years eve weekend afterall. They look like they have everything under control and they did; gracing us with sincere smiles at the same time. Another rarity nowadays. A big thank you to Mika, who accommodated my request and gave us a room that is overlooking the Vegas strip. So during new years celebration, we just opened the curtain and enjoyed the entire fireworks. We woke up our toddler to experience the fireworks and he was truly ecstatic to see all the lights - without the anxiety of the over blaring/loud sounds. Pool - 4 stars. Smartly designed outdoor pool (heated) and jacuzzi. I decided to take my son to see their pool area one chilly evening so I bundled him up. However upon entering the poolside, I noted that the temperature seemed nice and warm all over the area, despite it being outdoor. And this is because they have plenty of heatlamps all over the pool area - cleverly placed, I might add. This made the area consistently warm in addition to the heated pool. Had I known this beforehand, I would have had my son and I dip in their pool. But alas, it was our last night and we did not bring any swimwear. Who would have thought to take a toddler swimming in an outdoor pool during winter time. So now, you know... Another added bonus: This hotel have a NON-SMOKING POLICY and there is no casino in the premises. This can be a disadvantage to others but if you have kids and want a quiet, peaceful hotel in Las Vegas, then this one is definitely for you. I will definitely be staying here again when I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Back”
Reviews.Author: jstermer
Reviews.Content: I was met by Ann at the front desk whom treated me with the most professional care i have had by a hotel person in a long time. She did everything to make sure i had what i needed and showed genuine interest in my travels to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Business friendly with a nice staff and up-to-date ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Sroop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance Las Vegas from Jan. 15-22 while working a trade show in town. Arrived late Sunday evening and was able to enjoy a nice quiet drink at the bar from a polite and courteous bar/wait staff. The standard room was large and spacious, featuring a king-sized bed, armchair, ottoman as well as a large computer/writing desk. The hotel is located directly across from the LVCC, but since my convention was at the Sands, the rate was very affordable. Beware, if stayingat the hotel and there is a convention going on at the LVCC, the prices will skyrocket. A few hundred feet away is a Monorail stop, so commuting into the strip was simple. $28 for a three day pass was an ok deal. The Renaissance may be the only hotel in Vegas which is smole and game-free. Also, the Envy Steakhouse on premise, while pricey, has been rated one of the top-5 restaurants in Vegas since its opening in 2006. Finally, a well-equipped fitness center and outdoor pool/seating area (but out of season for my stay) made the Renaissance a very pleasant place to call home-away-from-home for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Convention”
Reviews.Author: JaysimTampa_Florida
Reviews.Content: I Spent 2 nights at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and attentive to all my needs. There was a problem with my reservation and a lady by the name of Ann went out of her way to fix the problem. This made all the difference to my experience and left me with a good feeling. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Perfect business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay again”
Reviews.Author: petengineer
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It's quite, clean, big and has everything. It has multi story parking. It's not a long drive from the strip .. like 5 to 10 mins. The room and the bathroom are spacious. The room has eveything you need. Beds are great .. standard marriott beds. No complains of anything. The onlyu this is no free wifi which hurts me everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Comfortable 100% NON-SMOKING! Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripesq
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a great New Years Eve weekend trip to Vegas and stayed at the Renaissance for the 1st time. We have stayed in many of the other Vegas strip hotels on countless other trips over the years. We will just break this review into what we liked and did not like about this hotel and some tips: What we liked: 1. Location, location, location. OMG, you cannot be closer to the monorail station and it's also roll out of bed into the convention center if you have business there. We have stayed at the Hilton before, it's close also, but you will get on to the monorail and into the convention center fastest staying here. 2. 100% NON-SMOKING Hotel. Hopefully one day all hotels will be 100% non-smoking but until people's personal fires are completely out, we have to cherish places like the Renaissance. They will kick your Buttola and charge you hundreds if you dare light up anywhere in this hotel. We love that! 3. It's clean, modern, and easy to get into and out. 4. Free easy close, large parking garage. Park, lock, and in minutes you are in bed. 5. Very professional and responsive staff. When we made a room request, it was completed fast. 6. Great Large Flat Screen LCD TV's What we did not like: 1. NO FULL LENGTH MIRRORS anywhere. The only mirror was over the recessed sink. You had to back yourself out the door of the bathroom to see your entire body and you were far away from the mirror with feet cut off. 2. NO close mirrors in the bathroom. The one mirror is recessed behind the sink like a wall painting and to shave or apply makeup or put contacts in we were breaking our backs leaning over the sink to get as close as we can to the mirror. Can't you put another mirror in there? 3. Haphazard maid service. These are the things in life that I wish had a rational explanation for: One day we have 4 bath towels, 2 wash cloths, 2 bars of soap, 2 shampoos, & 2 glasses. We use them all. We leave for the day, maid makes up room, we get back later and we have just 2 fresh bath towels, 1 washcloth, no bars of soap, no shampoo, and 1 glass. Call down to front desk: 10 minutes later we have lots of supplies. But what happened that it was necessary to make that call? It was NYE weekend and we were having a good time so we moved on—it’s okay. Tips: 1. There are generally 3 main views from this hotel: Pool View which also gives you a view of the parking garage; Monorail/Strip/Wynn Hotels view; Hilton/Convention Center view. The rooms with a Strip view go first. We had a pool view and it was fine. 2. Windows in the rooms do not open. 3. If you like to watch your car in the garage, ask for a pool view facing the garage and park on the 4th or 5th floor and you will be able to activate your car alarm from your room window it’s that close and direct. 4. Bring food and water. There are no doubt vending machines, but no restaurants or services close by—they have a little store with limited items and hours—it’s not a Strip hotel. Be prepared. 5. This is not a happening Vegas pool hotel. They have a pool but if you are looking for a “pool scene” head to the Casino Hotels like MGM or Mandalay and others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a family but look elsewhere if you have a choice”
Reviews.Author: jediplay
Reviews.Content: I knew this hotel did not have a casino so that was not a surprise but what I did not know was this hotel is a popular for meeting and convention gathering. During my three days of staying, the lobby was a mess and chaotic so I would suggest you check first if this kind of gathering bothers you. If I had known, I would have picked a different hotel. Hotel room – I was a bit disappointed with the room compared with other Renaissance hotels around the world. Considering this is Vegas hotel, it could do more with the room decoration. Bathroom – It was a good sized bathroom with a separate shower booth which was desirable preference. Club Lounge – It was closed throughout my stay so did not have an opportunity to experience it Room cleanness - It was poor at best. The room cleaning did not occur until 5 PM when we returned on the first day and housekeeping was still inside when we showed up. Considering we left the room at 10 AM, I expected the room already cleaned. Used glasses were left inside of the bathroom even after cleaning. Second cleaning, just for the hell of it, I’ve left a $5 dollar tip but the same spotty cleaning. I did not leave a tip for housekeeping when I checked out which is rare. Food – We did eat breakfast at the restaurant and on Christmas day, food was not good at all. The following day, it was much, much better so we figured that main chef was taking the Christmas day off. Lobby – The main lobby had some construction going on and also previously mentioned convention throughout our stay. Muslim gathering of some sort and there were so many people all day long and very noisy. Another thing that drove me nuts was elevator due to the people attending convention. I was on the top floor and it would stop on every floor to let people in and out. I understand hotel can’t do much on this but it drove me nuts. Every morning, each convention attendees were carrying two toasts and an egg riding the elevators up and down. Parking – Valet was quick and free (just few dollar tip) and self-park was easy as well with a plenty of parking space. Location – This hotel is not on the main strip but rather right behind the Wynn golf course. There is monorail station right next to the hotel so if you are moving by Monorail, this is a plus. Finding a main entrance is somewhat tricky at night since it is hidden from the main road. Overall impression – Based on my first stay at Renaissance Las Vegas, I probably would not return to this hotel considering so much choice at Vegas. Due to low hotel prices at even at top class hotel, there really is no reason to stay at this hotel. I’ve paid $109 per night and for $30 more, I could have stayed at Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michele R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful and a great break from all the New Year's Eve madness on the strip. It was nice to party and gamble over there but we welcomed the peace and quiet when we returned to sleep. Would definitely stay again especially since it is next to the monorail and you can buy an unlimited pass to go back and forth to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star at best”
Reviews.Author: marlene s
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying at Marriot hotels and was looking forward to a 5 night stay at the Renaissance. Arrived to a small noisy lobby, they had a conference but used the hallways for serving food and people gathering. Learned that the concierge level was closed for the month, something I would have like to have heard about before my arrival. Room with moldy showers, carpet that was wrinkled and a slipping hazard, and a sliding bathroom door that did not have a lock and kept opening (why no lock, sorry but that is something I prefer). Rooms for three were very small and cramped. The front desk staff was the only highlight of the stay, they were very friendly. Pool was nice. Gym was good size. Grabbed a to go breakfast at the E Go cafe, the food was excellent and the wait staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brooke J
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Renaissance, Las Vegas in November and I have to say it was such a wonderful place to stay. The staff was exceptional, Walter stowman, Guest Relations Manager went out of his way to make our stay at the Rebaussabce perfect, he made you feel so comfortable and I noticed him doing the same with other customers. He genuinely seemed intent on making sure my family had a perfect weekend, and we did. The doormen, Luis, Eddie and Rocky were always happy and courteous as was the front desk personnel Allan, Nancy, Corey and Timmra. I made it a point to learn their names because they all were so friendly, kind and helpful. It was such a pleasant vacation. The hotel was spotless, my room was really nice with an excellent, excellent view. The Renaissance is a beautiful hotel with a great location; so close to the strip but yet away enough to just sit back and relax without the loud noise and cigarette and alcohol smell. I would Absolutely recommend this hotel and will be staying there again the next time I am in Vegas. I will be sure to tell all my friends the same. What a friendly and welcoming hotel. Ihad such a pleasant experience at the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pointscollector
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 seven nights taking advantage of the 3 for 2 offer. I've stayed here several times over the past 3 years and my last experience a year ago was marred by issues I had with the consistency of the housekeeping. Putting that to one side I balanced the good with bad and decided the good far out weighted the bad, so I went for it again as this hotel in my opinion is ideally situated if you have a car, although without a car, as as other reviewers have commented it might be a problem; although the mono rail is very close and taxi's are plentiful. Accessing the hotel is easy by car and a lot quicker to get in and out of compared to many of the strip or downtown casino hotels where there are numerous stop lights and queues especially at night. The self parking is very easy and takes less than 5 minutes to walk from the top floor of the car park to the lobby, whereas in the some of the large casino hotels you sometimes have at least a 10 to 15 minute walk, valet parking is available if required. The rooms are large with a flatscreen TV with fancy digital TV options, an easy chair, desk and chair; plus a safe and fridge. The bathroom has both a nice large shower and large low level bath. The room I stayed in 1020 had a great view overlooking the Wynn golf course, sunrise relecting onto the distance mountains and the golf was really special and at night you can see the lights of the strip. The staff I found to be all very friendly. For those that may use the concierge lounge, the young lady looking after breakfast was first class. There was always a pleasant welcome to everyone entering, everything was kept well stocked and tables where cleared quickly to enable other guests to have a clean table. I did see reference in one review regarding security of the area, personally I felt as safe here as any other part of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely - Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eileen912
Reviews.Content: I have to say Renaissance Las Vegas was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at and I travel substantially! First and foremost their Guest Relations Manager, Walter Stowman went out of his way to make sure our stay at the Renaissance was flawless. The hotel was absolutely beautiful, our room was impeccable and I just can't say enough about the staff. Everyone from the doorman, front desk, waiters to housekeeping were nothing but curteous, friendly and helpful. It was so refreshing to stay at a hotel were the staff actually like their jobs and didn't treat you like you were a nuisance. Again, their Guest Relations Manager, Walter Stowman was always their asking if we needed anything and not hesitate to ask him if we did. I have never had a manager at any other hotel ask me this; actually at other hotels you can't find their managers. So Bravo Renaissance. It was a perfect vacation at a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: Blake C
Reviews.Content: After staying here every year for over 5 years to go to a trade show every August, this last trip felt like I'd gone to the Twilight zone. The room was horribly dirty and dusty, it smelled very musky, pain was peeling, the chairs had been soiled, and the wood desk and bureau was chipped and banged up. We asked to be moved, which we were told was "impossible" but not because there weren't other rooms, simply because they were "too busy." We then asked for a maid to at least come and reclean it. All the maid did was clean the dust with a rag then SHAKE IT OUT IN MID AIR INSIDE THE ROOM! Horrible experience, never again will I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: sedch
Reviews.Content: The good and the bad is that you do not feel like you are in Las Vegas. There is no gambling in the hotel and the lobby is beautiful and quiet. Some staff are freindly and helpful--others not so much. It is definitely a long walk to the strip and when we stayed the convention area was very quiet so we felt in the middle of no where. There is not a "quick" place to eat nearby so you are dependint on transporation or the hotel property restaurants... which were good but expensive.. We enjoyed leaving Las Vegas proper for day trips and sightseeing in the area and it is easy access to roads to get "out of town" If you want the Vegas excitement feel for your stay, I dont recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Curtious service”
Reviews.Author: T W
Reviews.Content: I just finished a long travel stretch (seven nights in seven cities). Anyway, I stayed at the Renaissance in LV and I had some self inflicted key issues (comes from being tired and frustrated with long travel. The guy working the desk (Cory) was very helpful, understanding, and cheerful...helping me through my problem. I appreciate his service greatly! TW

Reviews.Title: “Very Upscale Hotel But Away From the Craziness of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Banshee123
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions and the facilities have always been well maintained, the rooms are always clean and updated, and the staff is always very helpful and friendly. The pool is open late so that's a nice benefit to help wind down after playing at the casinos on the Strip. The hotel doesn't have a casino which is a nice perk to keep the smoke, trash, etc. out. It is a short drive to the Strip, or a short walk to the monorail station. Prefer to drive instead of taking the rail, if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Epi01
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel as it is non smoking non casino hotel, a fresh air from all the other surrounding casino hotels in Las Vegas. The hotel is clean and has comfortable bed and pillows and very close to the strip. Greatly recommended!!! Booked this thru priceline and got a great deal to boot. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air just minutes from the strip”
Reviews.Author: PhenelopeTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from November 12-15, 2011 to attend a wedding held at another hotel on the strip. Note this is not on the strip, but close enough. This hotel was selected as it was an inexpensive option and was away from the 'strip' of Las Vegas. What I mean by that is that there was no casino or smoking in the lobby and was presented as more of a 'business' oriented option. The hotel felt like any other Marriott hotel, nice, but not overwhelming in the Vegas sort of way. The hotel had a restaurant or two on sight and a small pool that was open 24 hours a day. We did not use the restaurants or the pool, so I can't fairly comment on these, but the pool looked nice. We were disappointed by the room service menu and ended up leaving the hotel for most of our meals. However, there was a small fridge in the room to store bottled water or food if purchased, but honestly, I love a well stocked mini bar and that was not to be found in this hotel. The bed was comfortable, the pillow options plentiful, and we appreciated the black-out drapes when we needed to sleep in after a wild night in Vegas. There was a coffee maker with decaf and tea options and an ironing board, iron and hair dryer also in the room. The one complaint I had was that there was no vanity mirror. I do not like having to lean over a bathroom sink and counter top to get close to a mirror to apply my makeup. The other complaint, and I know it sounds like I love mirrors, was that the only full length mirror in the room, was inside of the closet door, which would not stay open. So, in order to get a good look of what I was wearing, I had to stretch out an arm or a foot to keep the door open. I didn't appreciate that. I know, this is not important to most travellers, but these are truly my only complaints about the room. The room was very quiet and we had a wonderful sleep. Housekeeping was friendly. Overall, a great place to stay. Nice Aveda products in the bathroom and friendly staff at the front desk and throughout the hotel. We would stay here again, although I do like being right in the action while in Vegas, it was a nice rest away from the madness.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: natalie a
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the reviews and I'm glad I did.The hotel was very nice as were the staff.I liked that the hotel was not on the strip,so it was nice not to have to deal with the traffic.Rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.The bathrooms were larger than average with both a shower and a bathtub.Our room was on the 5th floor facing the back of the Wynn and at night we had a beautiful view of the hotels on the strip.It was conveniently located next to the monorail and the convention center.I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Getting That "Old" Feeling Already”
Reviews.Author: JP-NYCDFW
Reviews.Content: This is still one of my favorite value hotels in vegas, but the rooms are getting a little tired. My carpet had signs of wear, but the televisions and entertainment had been updated since my last visit. For the record, I'd rather have cleaner carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the action”
Reviews.Author: TravelsABunch
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are not in Las Vegas. It is too far from the Strip and you don't feel the vibe of Vegas in this hotel. This is a great choice if you are visiting on business and don't want to be bothered with the Strip. However, if you are there to visit Vegas and the Strip, do yourself a favor and stay closer.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the crazies and stay here for the R&R you need after the nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: Francofile1
Reviews.Content: Modern, attractive and hip hotel with all of the amenities but thankfully no casino. Makes it a peaceful oasis of calm. Enjoy the Las Vegas nightlife and "come home" to your serene room with touches of celadon and warm woods. Bathrooms are tastefully decorated in modern luxe. Lovely snow white linens, Aveda shampoo and soaps. Excellent in house restaurant and wine list. Knowledgeable staff. They answered our requests for an extra robe, etc. with cheerfulness and speed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jtessel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property recently and had a lovely time. The front desk staff was awesome and a big thank you to Andrea for a fabulous room. I would recommend this property to others looking to stay away from the noisy and smokey casinos on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: vincenzopwd
Reviews.Content: This is a good solid hotel. Some wear in the rooms, especially the carpet. Expect that everyone is gold or platinum Marriott rewards members. The concierges lounge is busy and small. Food was fair. There are no computers in the concierge lounge only in the business center (fee). While the hotel feels safe it is right on the edge of a dicey area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Best Front Desk Agent Ann”
Reviews.Author: moises z
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the hotel for my birthday weekend. I checked in and Front Desk, Ann, fixed my reservation that was scheduled for a later date. During my whole 3 night stay Ann was always there in the evening and always greeted me when I left. Have a very pleasant experience. Thanks Ann

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative to a Casino Property”
Reviews.Author: lowsiento
Reviews.Content: In town for a week long show and this was a great alternative to the typical casino property. Great marriott property that is within walking distance to the conventions center.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, close, cheerfully helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MWfromBoston
Reviews.Content: I spent most of this week in Las Vegas providing support for my spouse as she was speaking at a major tech conference. Having done this gig many times before, she had some definite opinions about where to stay when speaking at the Convention Center. The Renaissance is a non-gaming hotel (read quiet), which is right next door to the Center and the monorail station. Rooms were well appointed, and spotless. Food in the cafe was simple but good, with a great wait staff. The people behind the desk were also very helpful, and the doormen were outstanding. Everyone made you feel welcome. The only drawback was the charge for internet . . . no biggie for me as I have a Sierra card which worked well. If you find yourself attending an event at the Convention Center, and you like the convenience of going back to the hotel during the day (phone calls, change of clothes, etc.), this is the hotel for you. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Milton675
Reviews.Content: "Ann " at the front desk is Fabulous!!!!! Never underestimate the power of excellent customer service period!...Thats what keeps me coming back to Marriott(Platinum now)..:)its because of people like Ann, who make "loyal stakeholders" . Ann, not only took the time to accommodate my request but she went above and beyond to make me feel genuinely welcome! Thank you Ann! To Marriott Mgt....She is a role model for others!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Business Meeting”
Reviews.Author: EventPlannerNamb
Reviews.Content: We recently had a workshop with about 150 missionaries in attendance and this property far exceeded our expectations! The location was superb (not on the strip but close enough), the food was excellent and the staff was SUPER. My thanks especially to Brad, Tony, Kathleen, George, and the others from the banquet staff and especially to Vinnie, our bellman who was so helpful and full of life! The friendliness and compentency of the staff made this a very easy and enjoyable business trip! Darlene

Reviews.Title: “Carlton is the bomb!”
Reviews.Author: BBPolo
Reviews.Content: Our company stays here every year for the SEMA show and Carlton has always been there to give us excellent customer service! Thanks Carlton!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for an elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: A L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal, and far exceeded my expectations. The room was very nice, the staff was extremely courteous, and the breakfast at the adjoining restaurant was amazing. The level of service was on par with much more expensive hotels. Blake W was particularly helpful in getting our transportation taken care of. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel away from the strip but close to the monorail”
Reviews.Author: Gunda_10
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, stayed here as it was close to the convention centre. There are no poker machines which we really liked, the restaurant was good, staff very friendly particularly Anne at the front desk. Although it is not on the strip, it is close to the monorail and the best way to travel. The only complaint I have is the toiletries provided with the room are a little on the "mean" side; no shower cap, and the soap we were using went quite quickly. They should have an extra bar or two around. One thing we did actually run out of toilet paper as well the other day and they should have a spare roll of that as well. Having said that I would certainly stay here again, rooms are clean, the carpet seems a little bit jaded, it may just be the design. We stayed on the concierge floor and the lounge was good. I have read in previous reviews complanits about the internet but we have found it excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: TLinATL
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this Renaissance and really enjoyed the stay. Service was top notch, the view was fantastic, the room very well appointed. I appreciated the very modern bath with separate shower and tub area. The big unexpected bonus was FREE VALET PARKING, at most Marriott Hotels the valet parking can add 20 to $30 per day but here is was FREE. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to the monorail”
Reviews.Author: girlcats
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference in Vegas that took place at a strip hotel. As much as I wanted to enjoy the luxury of the hotel in which the conference was held, I was much more interested in maintaining my Marriott status so I passed up the luxury conference hotel for this one. I'd heard this was a good hotel so I decided to book 4 nights. It's actually a very good hotel for a business traveler. The concierge leve/lounge was clean and quiet and featured a nice breakfast selection. Regina does a great job of keeping the peace for the morning business travelers looking to grab breakfast. It's important to note that not all Renaissance properties have lounge areas worth talking about. My room was clean and there was actually a bit of a view of the strip. Aveda amenities and nice towels/robes made for a nice stay. The front desk staff is polite and quick to answer any questions. Carlton the doorman is a hoot! During my last day I left my luggage at the bell desk to head back to the strip. When I returned hours later Carolton quickly retrieved my bags and I was off to the airport within a minutes of pulling up to the front door. The monorail is a short walk across the convention center parking lot. This proved valuable in terms of quick commutes until one morning I found the entire station shut down due to some sort of problem - the signage posted didn't offer a resolution ETA so I hoofed it back to the hotel to cab it to the strip. Cabs are easy to catch at the hotel as long as there is a conference next door at the convention center. If the convention center is quiet you'll find fewer cabs available to you, which may not make a difference until you need to commute back to the airport. I'll definitely consider this property again for upcoming Vegas visits.

Reviews.Title: “Just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: loveladyc
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel that is near the convention center. We got on Priceline for 50 a night and was that ever a deal. Rooms nicely decorated as is the hotel itself. The tram is nearby but having a car is necessary if you want to leave the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative for convention Center attendees”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: Newer property with great TV and channel selection. Features high end steak house as well as a grab and go bistro. beds comfortable, rooms clean and well serviced. Only complaint is lack of knowledge and compliance with the Federal American With Disabilities Act. (ADA) Large Burly African American night security/doorman harassed us regarding our service animal, THEN followed to the room and asked to see my and my Service animals ID! Then the evening manager (Andrea Gagliano and Sarah the Supervisor) called at 2 am and DEMANDED to see MY MEDICAL RECORDS even after I informed them they were violating my rights and those under the ADA!!! I would have just left I WAS so upset I did not sleep the entire night which triggered a migraine. Its amazing how ignorance of the Laws makes for a terrible experience. When I informed the front desk rep what happened and she was shocked, she knew those questions are unlawful and said she would tell the GM Tom Xavier . I also asked he contact me. Apparently he knew what happened was wrong and he refused to contact me. Amazing how bad customer service exacerbates an indecent incident so I would not recommend this property based on the employees. BTW you can usually get this on priceline for about 60 a night, just choose convention area

Reviews.Title: “No hygiene here”
Reviews.Author: mikeboston1
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel located not too far from the Strip and it is on the LV Monorail track at the Convention Center station. The decor is modern - though starting to look a little worn. The rooms are standard Renaissance/Marriott though the televisions/cable seemed to be a little more advanced. The concierge lounge on the top floor has one of the best breakfasts that I have come across. The reason for the low rating is simple: This hotel does not remove the drinking glasses placed in the guestrooms. The glasses are washed in the bathroom sink with the same spray cleaner used to clean the bathroom by a cleaning person wearing the same rubber gloves he/she was wearing when cleaning the toilet. This is one of the most disgusting of practices in the hotel industry and every time I run into it the property will get a low rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SalesGirl5150
Reviews.Content: All the staff made me feel welcome and treated me very well. A shoutout to the bellman, Carlton Stewart. I would stay here again when I'm in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with an awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: mikee b
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Renaissance Las Vegas and I will return. The hotel is perfect right next to the tram and close to the places I like to visit. Every staff member treats you right, this stay Eddie Gomez did a great job. He remembered my name each time I left and arrived to the hotel and he was genuinely interested in what I had to say. Eddie is another one of the reasons I will stay at the Renaissance when I go to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice if for off strip convention center hotel”
Reviews.Author: amberleelucca
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay out of the hustle and bustle of what everyone knows Las Vegas to be - then this is a great alternative. This is close enough to the convention center to walk to and is clean with a great staff. The room service is pricey but yummy - the shoe string fries could feed an army!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraSanClemente
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Las Vegas is by no means a luxury Vegas hotel, but it is a comfortable business hotel, adjacent to the Las Vegas Convention Center. I would agree with most of the reviews given here. Several caveats I'd mention: we were on the 7th floor facing Paradise Road (rooms with a view of the strip) and the traffic noise was very noticeable, especially early in the morning and the room was very warm from the afternoon sun; I would suggest forgoing the view and getting a room facing east. If you are looking for a tan, the courtyard pool does not get a lot of afternoon sun. We stayed here for two weeks, and here are my pros and cons: Pros: Good size room and bathroom; separate tub and shower with good water pressure. Comfortable bed; bathrobes provided; Aveda toiletries were nice; very friendly and accommodating staff; non-smoking, non-casino hotel; easy walking distance to LVCC; quiet lobby, WSJ, USA today and LV Review Journal provided at bell desk; adequate club level lounge, although nothing special. Cons: spotty housekeeping - I've seen this in many reviews and wonder why management has not addressed the issue; thin walls - you can hear phone conversations next door; outside of the Convention Ctr, there are no restaurants or bars within walking distance; the ironing board had a stained cover with no padding, so my clothes picked up the grid pattern of the ironing board; the rooms are getting "tired" looking; smallest refrigerator I've even seen in a hotel room with no temperature control - ours did not keep beverages cold enough; not nearly enough hangers in the armoire. We mostly ate at the bar, which has the same kitchen as Envy, touted as one of the best steakhouses in Vegas. I had an excellent seabass one evening but a collegue ordered the $55 steak that was so pathetically thin, I would have sent it back. I noticed that Envy hasn't received the "best steakhouse in Vegas award" for several years now. (Suggest you go down Paradise to Ruth's Chris or Morton's where you get what you pay for.)The flatbreads were good as well as the roasted tomato soup. Blah salads. The other "restaurant" in the hotel is the E-Go Cafe which is a counter where you can order simple breakfast, lunch and dinner items from a counter and then sit at a few tables. They made a "skinny hazelnut latte" that is better than Starbucks. I had one every morning. The chicken noodle soup I ordered for one lunch was the worst I've ever had, so at best, it is a hit or miss type of place. Overall, for an extended business stay, we settled in and enjoyed the Renaissance. We will stay there again, but I hope management addresses some of the shortcomings of the hotel.Other than housekeeping, there is no way to improve the outstanding staff.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Lounge”
Reviews.Author: bevpbg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were able to use the Concierge Lounge. The staff was exceptional as was the food. One person in particular really impressed us - her name was Christina. She greeted each person coming into the room and made for a very nice experience. The rest of the staff at the hotel were also very helpful and seemed very sincere. Also like the fact that it was off strip (close to Monorail) and didn't have a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pam092281
Reviews.Content: If you want a clean, modern, smoke free, casino free experience - the Las Vegas Renaissance is perfect. While it is not on the strip...you are a short walk to the monorail that takes you there in minutes. It was great - the staff were accommodating...and the pool/hot tub area very pleasant. Not the typical Vegas experience (crowded, frenetic, smokey, super expensive) but a great place to stay a little ways away from the epicentre. Also buy a 3 day monorail pass...unlimited use for 3 days!

Reviews.Title: “It's not "ALL THAT"”
Reviews.Author: 0601TC
Reviews.Content: With all the nice photos, etc. I was really looking forward to our trip to Las Vegas and stay at the 4 star Renaissance Hotel. As we arrived at the hotel, we pulled in asked the bell person at the curb wearing what I would call a pimp hat, where we park to register. He directed me to the parking garage, told me to park on the third floor, take the elevator back down to the lobby and I would find the desk down thier.... No offer to valet, take my luggage or allow me direct access to check in... All which would be part of the 4 star treatment you would expect... The lady at the desk was friendly, got me checked in, but spoke so fast - not sure exactly what all she was telling me - bar here, pool thier, dial this to get that here is your keys welcome... Umm..ok... very canned spill... but you didn't tell me where's my room is and where is the elevator?? Ok, on our way to the room.... Special floor... Yeah!! got to the room, smaller (much) than expected... Plently of pillows on the bed - I think 8... Towels 1 big towel, 2 hand towels, no wash cloths and a bath mat.... plently for 2 people....right! But then the glass enclosed shower was a nice touch... with the exception of the mold that was beginning to show through at the base of the shower... exiting the bathroom, look down - carpet is worn to the point its almost a hole... Ok - well we are not in Vegas to stay in the room... got sights to see and shows to plan.... Room was warm, so set thermostat to 73 and headed out. Came back later that night, room still overly warm... made sleep hard. Next morning up before the sun, got our showers - shared our towel and by 8 a.m. were out of the room. Returned to the hotel about 5 pm to get ready to go to our frist show Terry Fator - Awesome show by the way... Housekeeper was in our room... this time she left us two big towels, two hand towels two wash cloths, no bath mat.... and all of our dirty towels from the previous night.... Room still overly warm... turned thermostat down to 64.... that helped get the room down to about 74... Got dressed headed out to the show.... When we returned for the night and headed to bed, I kept waking up through the night... couldn't figure out what was going on, but I kept losing my pillows.... The next moning when I got up, I found that the head of the bed was about 12 inches from the wall, and all the pillows were falling back thier... tried to move the bed, but it didn't move - so next night just shoved a bunch of the pillowd sown in the hole so I wouldnt lose the one I was sleeping with. The appearance of the hotel is nice - but it is defintely not a 4 star hotel - 3 star maybe... but definetly not a 4 star... can't see myslef ever booking this property again when I return to Las Vegas - to many choices that I am sure offer a more consistantly good clean service....

Reviews.Title: “A remarkable experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Ross C
Reviews.Content: I am a very frequent traveler (Marriott Platinum) so hotel after hotel is nothing new to me. This was actually a personal trip in which my wife was to accompany me for a weekend getaway to Las Vegas. Prior to my stay, I contacted the hotel to see if there may be any additional areas of value I might be able to gain and I had the pleasure of speaking with Andrea, the Front Desk Supervisor. She was incredibly helpful and upon my arrival personally greeted me and thanked me for my business. Above and beyond that I had actually been provided a room with a better view of the strip, which added significant bonus points from the wife. I cannot say that this was not a direct result of my status with Marriott hotels as I'm usually in one once or twice a week, but this is one of my most fondest experiences in a pleasant stay to date. I would HIGHLY recommend staying at the Renaissance LV - even though it's not a casino hotel, it's a great opportunity to take in what you want from the city and get away from the slot machine buzz! Plus, the tram station is right next door for easy access.

Reviews.Title: “"Multi-talented" professional Staff :)”
Reviews.Author: NancyP1975
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with your establishment and will have to say it will be the most memorable ever! My first and absolutely best venture was having the extremely talented saxophonist Vince open my cab door and greet me with the biggest smile! It has been many years since I have seen Vince perform in Atlantic City and could not believe he was standing right there before me. Even after mentioning to him that I remembered his show, he was still very professional and made sure that I got what I needed to settle in, making me laugh through the whole process. The rooms were very nice as well as all the management and staff and I would highly recommend to anyone. The non-smoking rule made the hotel and rooms smell fresh and relaxing. I would have given this hotel a 5 star but I had a hard time enjoying my delicious Sunday brunch with that caborat style act they had. I just cannot remember his name because I kind of rushed through my food to not listen anymore . I am sure that Vince is a very big asset to your company and later found out he normally would not have even worked on a Sunday. I think this hotel should reconsider the restaurant act and convince Vince to play his beautiful sax there on Sundays. I will recommend this hotel to all my travel friends and definately will be returning soon. Hope you change your entertainment before then !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Off Strip Hotel; Next to Las Vegas Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Rogerwny
Reviews.Content: Renaissance is a good, quiet off-the-strip hotel alternative. The hotel is right next to the Las Vegas Convention Center making for an easy walk. The hotel is not a casino and as a result it does not take long from check-in until you are at your room. Staff was friendly and helpful (directions, restaurant suggestions, etc.) Clean contemporary decor in both the lobby and in rooms. Room was clean, bed comfortable, large bathroom (separate shower and tub), flat screen HD TV, sitting chair, and business desk. Only odd thing at the desk area was lack of outlets -- not sure if that was room specific or found in all rooms. On west facing rooms, the view is quite good. View of the golf course, Wynn, Encore (and other strip hotels) and the mountains. Free parking at the hotel (can valet or self-park). Room service is available and food quite good. There is a quick-style restaurant in the lobby (coffee, breakfast items, sandwiches, soft drinks, etc.), Envy a steak restaurant, and a lounge area for more casual fare. Though it is walkable to the strip, it is a long walk and depending on weather, time constraints, how you feel, etc.,so suggest you may want to cab it or drive over. Took 12 minutes to get from the hotel to the LV rental car return at 4AM in the morning. With traffic, most likely more in the 20 - 25 minute range. Good stay and would definitely stay here next time in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Skydiggy
Reviews.Content: EVERYTHING is first rate at this off strip hotel. It's even quite easy to reach the strip or other destinations. Classy property, upscale lobby, inviting pool area w comfy settees and over-hanging palms. EVERY desk clerk and EVERY bell person, wait staff and chamber person greeted me pleasantly and seemed sincerely interested and helpful. Front desk clerks Anne and Nancy were especially helpful. Never waited more than a moment or two for a cab ( the mono-rail is just steps away and zooms over to the strip ( a cab, however will only cost about $8. For the short trip.) The rooms: very inviting, stylish, and the beds rivaled could be called "heavenly" with a fab. Selection of pillow densities. ( didn't want to climb out ). Bathroom was spacious with both tub and contemporary shower stall ( loved the Aveda products ) TV had a fine selection of channels. Wifi does cost extra, but that is certainly typical of many hotels. Concierge was very helpful and found me a fabulous hair salon nearby that did guy cuts...and thet even came and picked me up. Avoid the cafe / sundry shop: the prices are typically obscene: $2.00 candy bars and $5.00 fruit juices are the norm ( again typical of many hotels, they gotta make some money for the convenience, but...be careful) Finally...the food: while everything I had was with a conference the banquet food was first rate ( it was uniique, flavor-filled, hot, pleasantly presented, worthy of the large crowd ( nothing ran out).

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: NancyG562
Reviews.Content: I was here for a convention, rooms were super clean, staff was always smiling and helpful the envy steak house has great food. There was nothing that could have gone wrong here. Will definetly return again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel, convenient when at the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Jorge C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the week of Sept 26, 2011 for attending the Pack Expo. All to all, I had a good experience for the purpose of my visit. The hotel's location couldn't have been any better, right across the street from the convention center and from the Monorail Station. Facitilites are in very good shape and very well maintained, though it still is a business hotel, so nothing fancy like the main hotels on the strip. No casino on site either. It has a small pool at ground level, several meeting rooms on the second floor and free parking. There's a business center that you can use for a fee. Rooms are in very good shape and spacious. Bathroom is spacious and has a bath tub separated from the shower. My room had a Kingsize bed, a small sofa and LCD TV offering cable service and a small desk for work. Plenty of outlets to plug in my laptop and several charges on the desk. There's a small cafeteria serving snacks (bagels, panini, muffins), coffe and beverages throughout the day. The hotel also has a restaurant that serves breakfast buffet and operates as a stakehouse at nights (Envy Stakehouse). I didn't try it, but it's supposed to be one of the best Stakehouses in Las Vegas. Breakfast Buffet is not "Vegas style" buffet, it's more like the typical eggs-station, waffle station, fruit-station kind of service. There's a small executive lounge on the 15th floor that serves complimentary breakfast for guests staying on 14th and 15th floor. Variety is more limited than at the restaurant, but it still served my purposes. Wi-Fi and cable internet is offered at the hotel, but it's not free of charge. It costs around 13 USD per day and it works noon-to-noon, in other words, if you pay to connect in the morning, the service stops at noon, thus you have to pay again if you want to connect again in the afternoon (and it would be valid until noon the next day) and so. Staff is very friendly. I purchased a couple of things in advance and had them sent to the hotel. All my packages were given to me upon checkin with no problem. They charge you 6 USD per package, though. Concierge can help you with getting tickets for most of the shows at good prices. We accidentaly left our passports and money in the safe and didn't notice it until at the airport. So we came back and found out that all our belongings had been propperly secured by the Security personnel and were returned to us unharmed (after showing propper ID, of course). All to all, I would recomend this hotel only if you're going to the Convention Center. Otherwise, it is too expensive and far from the Strip. During that particular week, it was about 50% more expensive than The Encore and the same price than Aria or Cosmopolitan (all offering free internet).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel review from a guest point of view”
Reviews.Author: Peg H
Reviews.Content: Rooms were large and comfortable. Hotel was completely full and I didn't hear a single loud noise at night. I'm a business traveler and appreciated the nice 4 star restaurant and bar for a nice dinner.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Dee Dee A
Reviews.Content: From the moment your car/taxi pulls up to the front till the time you leave you will be sincerely greeted/acknowledged by every employee that crosses your path! Everyone there is "delighted to serve" you. The valet is just as wonderful as Martha, who answers your calls, is. Rob is the manager and has a wonderful crew at the front desk. They will accomodate your wishes and your room is always spotless. If you need extra hangers just pick up the phone and before you can unpack someone is knocking at your door with them. As for the food...OMG! Their Envy Restaraunt is definitely envied by the other restaurants in town. Supurb wine list and whatever your choice of meal is you can't go wrong. I have tried everything they serve and have not been disappointed. If you're a foodie, Chef Mike does some awesome creations. You have to ask to sit in Joe's (Joey) section and he will make your evening the best it can be. If you want to hit the casinos step right outside and catch the monorail, it will take you to the strip which is only a couple blocks away and when you've won all you need hop back on and return to the peace and quiet of the Renaissance. If you're there for a convention it doesn't get any easier. Sleep a little longer and just walk next door to the Convention Halls.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: DavidBedfordshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Happy that we picked this hotel for our holiday stay. Easy to find, complimentary valet parking and right beside the monorail making it a good base for what we wanted to do. Had room overlooking strip and golf course - seemed fairly new. Friendly staff in bar and good range of bar food. Envy restaurant fine but a bit pricey and limited on the menu. Seems to be mainly a business hotel but we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but missing a few perks.”
Reviews.Author: Foodie4lifeiam
Reviews.Content: I wanted to try at this hotel since I am a Marriott customer. The room is nice and there's a a good Steakhouse located inside the hotel. I do have a few complaints though since there is no mini bar which I found unusual. Also in room dining is not 24 hours. There are times when I just don't feel like leaving the room. I would recommend this hotel if you are attending a convention next door, and remember to bring your own beverages and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “My Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: Dom B
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and I am always happy to go back to Vegas and stay at The Renaissance. The staff is friendly. The hotel itself is great!! The workout room is better then most hotels that I go to. A short walk to the Monorail so you can get to the strip if you prefer. The rooms are nice and modern and then beds are comfortable. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I remember, spotty service.”
Reviews.Author: bk_t1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times several years back (no reviews yet), but I was somewhat let down this time. First, as a Plat elite, I had access to the club level and free wifi. The hotel was busy, so no upgrade or club floor room. The room was at the end of the hall, a little smaller than I remember, and a little aged. There was an armoire in the room for clothes, no closet, bed was a little worn in, too. LCD tv was nice, but had to get maintenance to reprogram it since it didn't work when I first turned on. Housekeeping was very inconsistent; no newspaper twice in 4 nights, no bath product replacements, and no towel mat one night. Lastly, no coffee maker in room. Unfortunately, since the hotel was fairly booked, service in the club lounge was spotty, too. Location is great, next to monorail, so I will probably stay here again if the rate is right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But A Ways Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_Hotlanta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance for 3 nights (2 for business and one for pleasure), and the staff were very helpful, the hotel clean and modern, the bed comfortable, and the pool nice for relaxing or for families with children to play. The only negative was that the hotel is a decent distance from the strip (although the train or tram is nearby - but I didn't take it), and it was sometimes hard to get a cab. The restaurant in the hotel, Envy, was outstanding and one of the best places we ate at in Vegas. A real find and a surprise for hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melnag26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this past weekend, September 22 and 23. I booked through Priceline and got a great deal. It's off the strip, but not too far off the strip...just minutes away from the Venetian. Pluses: Quick check-in, I even got to check in early. Free valet parking, but we just used the free self-parking. (Not sure if the free valet parking was because of Priceline). Large enough room. Loved the Aveda shampoo and conditioner. Able to use my gold Marriott membership, and got free wifi (normally $12.95 from noon to noon) and the lounge. (No free breakfast though. They only have a cafe). The lounge was okay (cheese, cold cuts, crackers, veggies, chili, fried rice, soda and water) Negatives: The bathroom doesn't lock. There was mold in the corners of the shower. You can hear the neighbor's conversations clearly.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets”
Reviews.Author: Pablo A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because they were running a free night special. We were going for our Anniversary so we wanted to stay at a 4-star hotel but couldn't afford the strip. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat; here's why: - Quiet, no casino, no smoking, no shows, so not a lot of tourist traffic. The valet never gets too backed up. - Great service: Everyone in the hotel is helpful and courteous. We only stayed 3 nights but Carlton and others at the valet recognized us quickly and always greeted us warmly and helped with anything we asked for - Close enough to everything: We rented a car for the 3 days ($53!) and that served us well. The strip is too long to actually walk and all the hotels have free valet parking. So we'd drive from the Renaissance to wherever we wanted to be, valet park for free, and walk around to the nearby hotels/attractions. Even a cab shouldn't run you more than taking it from one end of the strip to the other. Look forward to staying there again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Cecelia A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a quick weekend and we enjoyed our stay. The staff was very courteous and polite and room service was very quick!! Its a non smoking and non gaming hotel so it was very quiet, which is what we wanted. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Poor Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: PhiAE01
Reviews.Content: This is a tale of two sides to one hotel. On one side, you have the fabulous front desk staff, valet, and bell hop staff. On the other hand you have the housekeeping staff who need a bit of help. The basics have been covered elsewhere, but I will say that this hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the monorail and a $12 cab ride to the main section of the strip. They have a wonderful work out room with 4 elliptical, 5 treadmills and a lot of nautalis equipment. Unfortunately this is offset by the fact that there are only 2 TVs and the workout equipment (other than the treadmills) are not hooked into their audio. The rooms are spacious. Oddly, or wonderfully, they have a separate tub and shower. The tub has no hand-held wand nor shower head (or curtain) so it really is only for soaking. The front desk attendant, Saul, was wonderful. Helping me split the check to keep my accountants happy and helped me print out a boarding pass when the computer crashed and burned on the US air pop-up windows. Vince and his crew of valets were fast and efficient -- just amazing, and friendly. The Tamara, also at the front desk, arranged an amazing and well priced spa day, with no notice. Then there was housekeeping. Our room was missing: hangars (literally none in the closet), the hair dryer and the iron. I'm not sure what caused the previous occupant to remove all of these items, but I felt that housekeeping should have spotted it before we took occupancy, or not taken 30 minutes to scrounge up new ones. The concierge lounge on the 15th floor was nice as always, but it lacked the necessary counter space and thus the poor attendants were run ragged trying to keep up with everyone's "special" requests for things like jam and hot water. Additionally, the drink selection was limited to coke, pepsi and water.

Reviews.Title: “no smoke or casino - a vegas dream”
Reviews.Author: Sparkatude
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel right next door to the convention center. The building is non smoking and has no casino which is a relaxing treat for anyone doing business in Vegas. Big, clean rooms and nice amenities. Very short walk to the monorail for easy access to the strip. I definitely will stay at this Marriott next year.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: dougpickering5
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Las Vegas is right by the convention center, short walk (can't believe anyone can complain about the length of that walk) to a monorail stop and maybe a 20, 25 minute walk to the north end of the strip. Hotel is in great shape. Common areas, the pool, our rooms were all perfect. Rooms are a good size with big bathrooms and very comfy beds. Everything was very clean. Check in and out was a breeze. Each staff member we dealt with was excellent. Best staff of any hotel I've been to in Vegas and I've stayed at a lot of hotels in that town. Onsite restaurant, Envy, lived up to it's reputation and is definitely one of the top restaurants in the city. Great stay at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive.”
Reviews.Author: liz B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance on business, I was surprised to hear this is a non-gaming hotel, but I didnt miss gaming one bit. The hotel was very nice, service was great and it was easy to navigate (unlike the huge casino/hotels on the strip). The Renaissance is within walking distance to the monorail, which can take you to the strp within minutes, or the convention center. Bar/wait staff were all friendly and personable, food at the bar and cafe was great- i didnt try the steakhouse, but i heard nothing but great things.

Reviews.Title: “Best Las Vegas hotel experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: RevStevePDX
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas a couple dozen times over the years for business and pleasure, but I've never had as good a hotel experience as I did when I stayed at the Renaissance last week. From the moment I checked in until I left three days later, everyone on the staff treated me with smiles, excellent service and respect. I love the fact that the entire hotel is non-smoking, and that they don't have a casino! Heaven on earth for me. As if that wasn't enough, Envy is one of the best restaurants I've ever had a meal in. And I had several! Breakfast, lunch and dinner for three days, and I loved every bite. I know where I'll be staying on my next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/food/etc., but poor management!!”
Reviews.Author: Hunter003
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times, and are active members of Marriott's Rewards Program. However, our last stay was marred by (1.) a room that was not properly cleaned (2.) no bathrobes-then they brought 1, then another trip for the 2nd one, then another trip to bring bathroom amenities (shampoo, etc.). Very noisy neighbors-it took several phone calls to the front desk before they sent up security to quiet them; same thing the next night. When I approached the front desk manager about the situation, she completely "blew me off"-gave me a free drink ticket and said "that's the way it is". Even upper management ignored my email and did not respond. I must say this is not typical of Marriott as we have stayed in their hotels/resorts in many countries and they usually are much more attentive. Too Bad!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Off-the-Strip Hotel; next to LV Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: theamatuerjetsetter
Reviews.Content: Staff: Very welcoming and helpful. We had 2 rooms and they were able to put us pretty near each other on the same floor. The bell-persons were very efficient in checking everyone's luggage into storage when the line started getting long. Rooms: The rooms are fair in size, very clean, and pretty up-to-date--typical 3.5-4 star hotel. Also, for those who care, they carry Aveda products in their bathrooms. Amenities: I didn't really explore the amenities but could see the pool area from the lobby. The pool area is very small relative to the typical Las Vegas resort pools. Overall, the Renaissance Las Vegas is a great choice if you tire of the constant whizzing and whirring of the slot machines. The hotel also neighbors the Las Vegas Convention Center, if you happen to be in town for a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, convenient, comfortable Vegas hotel without a smokey casino!”
Reviews.Author: killergriffin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights this summer while we were in Vegas taking care of family business. We got a great price, but wouldnt have complained if it were more, because we were able to walk in, unaccosted by smoke and the typical casino sounds and smells, to a beautiful, calm, classy lobby each morning and evening. There was some road construction right in front of the hotel at that time, which made entering a little confusing, but it seemed to be temporary, and wasn't a problem. The fitness center was great, the pool just fine. I'd stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great non gaming hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: Boonology
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 10 mins drive from the strip. Will be more convenient for those who are driving. Other than that, the hotel is a great gem. Very clean, comfortable beds, welcome drink at the lobby. We enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lainmav
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Renaissance Las Vegas Hotel after bidding on Priceline. The hotel was beautiful and it was a great place to stay during our first visit to Las Vegas, it is very close to th monorail. The parking was free, bed was comfy and the rooms were clean... not much more you could ask for!

Reviews.Title: “It was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dana c
Reviews.Content: I had my mother with me on this business trip and by the end of our stay the staff was calling my mom...mom! The primary valet was Tom, he really made us feel welcome, actually made us feel at home, immediately. Ann, one of the Front Desk Staff, took great care at selecting an awesome room so my mom didn't have to walk far from the elevator.
