Reviews.Title: “Carlton in valet makes this hotel better than it should be”
Reviews.Author: jels68
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping left the room dirty, maintenance didnt respond at all to fix a broken door handle, but the hotel was good for the price. Carlton is their best employee by far.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of peace and tranquility, away from the total tackiness of 'the strip'”
Reviews.Author: SAFARIMAN80
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I have to go to Las Vegas [ugh!] at least once a year for a conference and always have to stay in the Bellagio which I hate with a passion. Before checking into the Bellagio I spend 1 or 2 nights at The Renaissance. It's a haven of peace and tranquility, away from the total tackiness of 'the strip'. No casino, no one armed bandits, just a well appointed, SMOKE FREE property with great staff and friendly service. Excellent rooms and great bathrooms. If you have an event at the Las Vegas Convention Center, you cant do better than this property which is a short 2 minute walk away from the LVCC. Envy Steakhouse provides great service. Best of all Lotus of Siam, the best Thai restaurant in the western USA, is a short cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Okay - Not Great, Definitely Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Lolane
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a conference at the Convention Center. I decided to stay at the Renaissance because it was in walking distance to the Convention Center and it is a non-smoking hotel. I'm sure the walk in colder weather would be quite reasonable, but in the July heat it was almost unbearable. This is not necessarily the fault of the hotel, but if you're staying here because it's in walking distance and you don't do well with heat, you may reconsider. The room was clean, well decorated and fine, though I was not impressed with the door separating the bathroom - it would not keep odors out of the main room due to a large gap between the floor and the bottom of the door. The bartending staff was extremely nice, but the food was just okay. The restaurant is very expensive but it's a pain to get anywhere else (cabs don't come by as frequently as strip hotels, and you have to walk across a large parking lot to get to the monorail). I don't mean to sound down on this hotel - the staff was actually very nice and the hotel is better than decent. One nice valet guy even got me a bottle of cold water on my way out to the conference without my even asking. My main issues with the hotel were it's location not being as ideal as I thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick E
Reviews.Content: As I travel more than 240 days a year I have to say that this hotel is by far one of the best I have stayed at. The entire staff makes you feel welcome, from the doormen and valets out front, to the staff at the front desk and the staff at the Envy Steakhouse and not to forget the ladies in club lounge, you always feel like you are at home. I love this hotel. One more person I have to mention, the Guest Relations Manager is very top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: plonkmon
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed, very clean bathroom with both tub and shower stall and adequately furnished with a good desk chair and lounge chair with ottoman. Friendly and helpful staff and an excellent breakfast at Envy. Didn't use the monorail to get to the strip as planned but about a $15 taxi ride made it easy and hassle free to get to shows and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...Best We've stayed in so far!”
Reviews.Author: ladykulit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located off the strip, blocks behind the Wynn hotel. I dont think it is walking distance to the strip (the only negative thing I can say about this hotel) but there is a tram that can be used to travel from the hotel to the Las Vegas Strip. The area around the hotel was quiet. Free parking in a parking garage was available. The lobby was very spacious...and beautiful. The staff were courteous and helpful. The room was AMAZING! We booked a hotel suite and it was gorgeous. Very spacious. The room was clean and well decorated. The living room area had a sofa that pulls out to a bed. There were 2 bathrooms. The main bathroom included a jacuzzi. All your amenities were included. We even had 2 flat screen TVs. Loved loved loved this hotel. Will definitely stay here next time we go to Vegas. We booked this hotel for only $89/night and it was cleaner, more beautiful and spacious than the hotels we have previously booked on the Las Vegas Strip (ex: Monte Carlo)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service from Outstanding Team Members”
Reviews.Author: DarylKingsland
Reviews.Content: While our treatment by the staff, the cleanliness of the rooms, and the total ambiance of the Hotel was wonderful, I feel that our stay was enhanced by the over-and-beyond performance of specific persons employed there. Our stay began with the lead Valet, Carlton Stewart, and his friendly manner, knowledge of the area and events, and just plain "make you feel welcome" appeal of his personality. He is without a doubt one of the best Valet people I have come across in my many years of travel. Along with Carlton, we were given BEYOND red-carpet attention and treatment by Wilfredo. With the odd hours we kept during our stay in Sin City, it seemed he was always there to help us with our baggage, packages, car care, and much more. I wonder if he ever slept or went home. We come in at 1230am and he's working. We arise early the same morning at 600am, and he's there. We come back again that evening at 9pm, and he's there again. This man should earn a promotion for his efforts, attention to detail, and general work ethic. Teamed with Carlton, the management of this hotel have a winning combination. The 3rd person I'd like to mention is the concierge, Kathy S. She was not only helpful in our trips to the Strip and Show tickets, she was invaluable to us with her knowledge of the local areas, places to shop, and inside information for wonderful restaurants. While we enjoy playing tourists, we happen to also prefer to "go where the locals" go to shop and eat. Overall, our stay was relaxing, comfortable, and well above average. Our treatment by these people and the other people at the Renaissance showed that you don't have to be on "The Strip" and have a ton of glitz and glamor to bring a quality experience to the table. Kudos to all; Daryl Kingsland ReAnn Kingsland Great Falls, MT

Reviews.Title: “It's now my only place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBusyWoman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while I was attending a conference at UNLV. Check in was a great experience and the woman at the front desk was very kind and went way out of her way to give us the kind of room we wanted. It was lovely for us not to have the hassle of walking through a long, winding, smoky casino to check in and get to our room. Blissfully, smoke free! The room was comfortable and stylish. The pool was nice, but not spectacular. It had the nice summer feature of being in the midst of a small ground level courtyard surrounded by the tall hotel -- so there was ample sunny and shady areas available to relax nearby. Location was a major plus. The Las Vegas convention center is next door and with it is its monorail stop. The Renaissance is not on the strip, but you can quickly, easily, and cheaply take the monorail to the hotels and attractions that are. I have access to the concierge lounge during my stay and found it to be nice with a good breakfast. It would tend to get overly crowded around 7:30 am (at least that happened both mornings we were there) while having plenty of room both earlier and later. we also enjoyed the desserts they had there late one evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff,service and amenities , Love to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Henry D
Reviews.Content: As a Marriot's platinum member i would first like to thank Margie Arce for her courteous and professionalism in accommodating me with a superb room even at near capacity. The consignor was excellent. They tended to all my family needs and made us feel as we were home. Can't say much about the room but, " THE BEST EVER". I didnt get to try the restaurant but by the looks of the menu, I can't hardly wait till next time. It was truly one of the best hotels of stayed at. My thanks to all the staff including the Valet attendants which work hard throughout the night. It was an awesome experience for me and my wife.. Respectfully, Henry Diaz Marriot Platinum Member

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable off strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: flipper95
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel near the convention center, on a never ending under construction Paradise Road. Ive stayed here a few times. The room is comfortable, good bedding and bath amenities (Aveda products). The hotel has good conference and event facilities so you can expect some traffic and lots of people but you will be relieved to escape the noise and bustle of a casino hotel. A couple of peevs- the sound insulation between rooms is less than I would expect, I often here conversations or TV from adjacent rooms. The sound proofing was poorly done. I do not hear anything from outside however. The Platinum / Gold amenities are poor- no comp'd breakfast or lounge access during the weekend. Last, trying to get to this hotel can be hassle, as Paradise is under construction you could only turn in one direction out of the hotel making a right on paradise. Hopefully the construction has been finished by now but Ive noticed over several stays in the past year that Paradise is just a continual mess. In short, a good hotel, it misses some points though. I would stay there again as its the only hotel I can for my corporate discount and its pretty decent overall.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: a bit more off the strip then I expected but loved the room and the Front Desk person ANN was great and very accomodating ... the room was comfortable and parking was easy ... the short commute to the strip was not a problem ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Steelerfans2
Reviews.Content: Close to the Strip and convention center, this is a great room and I will stay here again next time. The room was spacious and clean, King size bed was very comfortable. You would pay at least twice the price for a room this size on the Strip. Room included a clothing iron which I appreciated. We went to the pool in the morning and it was wonderful and not crowded. It is nice being close to the action on the Strip but still having some solitude, a very peaceful stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'm usually a big fan of the Renaissance brand”
Reviews.Author: csis046
Reviews.Content: But the Las Vegas one was just off. The desk staff was rude (not because there was a long line of people, there were two of us) The woman covering the desk at 6 a.m. didn't even look up when I asked for directions/coffee. Our room phones didn't work. Not sure if those ever got fixed 'cause when I went to the front desk to ask about it the guy walked into the back room and never came back. The Steakhouse was wonderful quality. Our server, Joshua, was a delight and very quick with a calming glass of wine. Seriously indulged my daughter's salt addiction with their gourmet salts, a fun little food adventure. I'd go back to the restaurant, but the hotel... not so much

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, it must be the best in Las Veas in 2011.”
Reviews.Author: Mtvernon60952
Reviews.Content: I arrived the hotel around 7pm in hot day in August 2011 due to the flight delay from NY and because of late check in, there was no suite room available for upgrade which I was expecting to get as gold elite member. From long trip from NY and hot summer heat in Vegas, I was a kind of sad and depressed at the moment but Ann, front receptionist took care of us with exceptional services which I had never get from any other hotel in US. Especially, she tried to accomodate me for suite room which seems no availability but she gave us the courtesy drink at bar while we wait her to look for any suite which does not show availability on the computer. Finally she came with nie smile and brought me the key which she said the room for suite. I never felt so good for along time that her professional cortesy and exceptional kindness. I am sure I will be back to Renaissance if I come to Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Tvincentdavidson
Reviews.Content: I got a great price through price line.com. The room was a little small and could use a little updating but the staff made up for it. Valet service was quick and so polite. my friend was under the weather and they heard me mention getting water, They immediately went and got us two icy bottles of water. The staff just really made our stay there lovely. The hotel is off strip but very close to the monorail which is easy to use and much cheaper than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: anita t
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent, very friendly.. Excellent customer service. Love the stay , non - smoking room, no casino, loved that , nice and relaxing . Laying by the pool side everynight no noise. Wonderful. Check-in day one, wonderful. Will be back, only when i want to relax, no noise. Location for transportation not really good. You will have to know how to use the bus , and monorail service, in which both are good to get to the stripe. They do not have shuttle transportation to and from the airport which i think the amount you pay for the rooms, you should at least have transportation to the airport and from. Rooms should have a mini microwave. ENJOYED, LOVED MY 5 DAY STAY, WILL BE BACK. July 25 - July 29th. A Thomas

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room”
Reviews.Author: sassychigal
Reviews.Content: I booked my room on price-line and luckily it was next to the Convention Center. Upon check in I negotiated a free room upgrade - It wasn't easy but well worth it. After spending one night in a small room, I was upgraded to the hospitality room, which was 3 times larger and included a dining table and mini fridge with microwave! The room was quiet - heard no outside noise from the hallway. The pool area was nice - not really for swimming since its only 3 feet deep and in the shade, but the lounge chairs and music were so inviting and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “afforrdable, convenient and loved it”
Reviews.Author: ekarhin
Reviews.Content: great place to stay..it was within walking distance from the host venue..the convention center..loved my time day.paid just 50 bucks/night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but needs some BIG improvements”
Reviews.Author: NyTravelinMan14
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is very nice and the staff is EXCELLENT. There were a number of shortfalls however that make many of the other area hotels preferrable over this hotel: 1) Maid Service was tops a 3/5. Found the sink to be left dirty and some mold in the shower that has been there a while. Also, asked for extra towels daily and got them once in a while. Ran out of toilet paper twice during the week long stay. 2) Room has almost NO storage for clothing. 2 drawers at ankle height off the floor and a wardrobe with 6 hangers. Not at all adequate when staying a week for a trade show at the convention center next door. 3) Internet is $19.99 a night PER DEVICE! The Marriott Courtyard across the street is FREE. 4) Food choices are VERY limited. There is only 1 restaurant that has excellent but expensive food and a cafe that is prepackaged food and closes early, leaving only limited room service as an option and no gift shop at all. 5) Breakfast staff and seating was severely limited and understaffed, causing a big back up, a restaurant 2/3 empty/unused and very unhappy guests. 6) I was also given the wrong room (supposed to be 15th floor city view), got 11th floor backside and had to remind them that I also had concierge suite access which they also forgot. 7) Newspapares were very tough to come by if not impossible most days. 8) Could use more accessable outlets for charging phone and other devices. On the plus side: 1) Overall, the staff was excellent, especially the ladies in teh concierge suite and the valet's outside. Always greeted with a smile, often by name and genuinely warm. 2) Hotel is next to the South Hall of the Las Vegas Convention Center. A very short walk and the monorail is very close as well. 3) Restaurant food although expensive for dinner is 5 Star, as is the breakfast and breakfast is more reasonably priced. 4) Concierge suite is well stocked, friendly and comfortable, but does lack a fax machine. 5) Room cost was reasonable and competitive. 6) Bedding was very comfortable and the room included a small fridge which was very handy. 7) Overall room size is comfortable and pleanty of flat surfaces to put things on.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Las Vegas Hotel - no casino is a plus”
Reviews.Author: lithlith
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance Las Vegas Hotel for two nights in August 2011 on a Thursday and Friday night. We had a room on the 14th floor (14th and 15th floors are the club levels with the lounge on the 15th). The view from our room was nothing special; it over looked the parking garage and was opposite of the strip. Our room was nice, a little on the smaller side for a Marriott, but same/typical clean Marriott design. My big complaint was the bathroom. It was all one room with a sliding pocket door with no lock. There was one sink. There was a separate tub and shower and the shower was clear glass box. If you are staying alone, then the bathroom would be fine, but otherwise if you are trying to share the bathroom you have little privacy. Friday morning we were awoken by an alarm of some sort. We looked all around the room trying to find it before realizing that it was from the room next door, but sounded like it was in our room...so the walls are a little thin. The club lounge on the 15th floor was nice, but closes at 10am on Friday, so we didn't have much time to take advantage of it since we arrived on a Thursday. The plus for me, was that they had glass bottles of coke available (and I've found that most marriotts only carry pepsi). We had breakfast in the lounge on Friday morning. There was an employee at the door checking peoples names before letting us in, which we found odd. The breakfast choices were minimal at best. It was also very crowded at the time we were there. We didn't use the pool, but you can't help but see it because it is in the middle of the hotel and conference area with huge glass windows. Unfortunately, the sun only hits about half of the pool area, so there is a lot of shade, plus a lack of privacy due to all of the windows surrounding it. The front desk staff was great and the valets were friendly. There is complimentary valet parking and free self parking available as well. There is a small area that sells coffee, snacks, muffins, etc. in the hotel as well as a steakhouse, but we didn't eat at either. The walk to the monorail station would take 2-3 minutes. There is a McDonalds down the street (maybe a 5-7 minute walk), but that is the only other food close by and I wouldn't have wanted to walk there out in the full sun. This hotel is definitely not on the strip and isn't in walking distance of the strip. There is also a lot of road construction between the hotel and the strip, but traffic was always moving. It was nice to come back to this hotel after being on the strip because it didn't have a casino. It was a nice break from the smoky casinos. The Las Vegas convention center is literally right next door to this hotel, so if your conference is there or at this hotel, then this is a great place to stay. My husband's conference was at the Rio and a cab ride to the Rio was $16 before the tip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough and Not Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: pickitravelerNash
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at this property for work for several days in late July, and I flew to LV and stayed with him for two nights. We are Marriott owners so we often stay in Marriots whether on vacation or business. The hotel is fine but nothing to get excited about. It's clean and comfortable. However, the location is not on the strip and is too far to walk. There was a large bit of construction between the hotel and the strip. If this construction were not there, walking to the strip may be more feasible. The parking is fine, and my husband told me it was free, although I'm not sure if this is for all guests or just gold/platinum card holders. The biggest disappointment was the pool. While the pool and lounge areas of the pool are nice, the pool is located in an interior courtyard of the hotel and can be seen through large glass windows/doors from the lobby, and it appeared from some of the rooms. It was surrounded and shaded by the large brick walls of the hotel, and pool goers are prancing around for all to see (although there were not many people at the pool when we were there). I also saw several people smoking in thepool area. I assume this was being done since it was outdoors. However, I saw hotel personnel making hand motions though the glass at a couple of smokers in what appeared to be an attempt to stop the smoking. I doubt it's allowed even in open areas. The hotel did have a couple of restaurants which is nice and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “More than worth it if not a serious gambler.”
Reviews.Author: nomad1987
Reviews.Content: Went solo through a priceline deal for a weekend. I do like gambling to a certain extent and the distance helped curb some impulses hah. The hotel itself is excellent. Staff were expedient with check in and the room was very clean. The bathroom was very clean as well. Cleaning staff did their job. Bed was comfy as well. Though the pool seemed like perennially in the shade, I went to the pool to swim and I was glad I didn't receive any of that 110 deg heat! Food options are very limited nearby if you are a cheap foodie ( meals under 10 bucks for me please) like me. Though if you are willing to spend, the coffee shop and envy have reasonable food choices. Coffee + bagel for 4 bucks seemed reasonable atleast for breakfast. Must say though the monorail station is VERY close ( like a 1 min walk) , the stations were sort of inconvenient in my opinion. Lots of walking involved and seemed like the system aimed at a family rather than a young individual who seeks to go to a lot of casinos. Monorail was safe and stations were spotless though ( at all times) .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Club Lounge and great overall hotel”
Reviews.Author: PDXBigGuy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times, but not in the last two years. I was very pleasantly surprised this time with the recent upgrades. The tiny, fuzzy TV is now a 50" flat screen with pretty much all HD programming (60 channels, 5 HBO channels!). The gym has 5 Precor treadmills, compared to the mismatched cheap ones before. The Club (concierge) lounge has great food (breakfast and afternoon snacks,) but the greatest part is the staff--all great, but in particular, Christina, who is simply the friendliest and most helpful staff member I've ever met at a Renaissance club lounge. The room, bathroom, check-in/out, internet (free to Platinum and Gold members), and decor are all great. There's also a very useful safe and small fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is a convenient place to stay for those attending conferences at the convention Center, Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: RitaGurgaon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for those attending conferences and concerts at Las Vegas convention center. It is only a short walk away from the center. There is an Indian restaurant close by. The hotel is a good option and provides value for money. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff at the concierge is most courteous. The front office staff is equally efficient and quite responsive to the needs of the customers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Too Far Away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: irishfaith
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. I was travelling for a business conference. The rooms were nice and the meeting areas were good. This hotel only has one restaurant onsite and it's very pricey. They have a cafe style place to grab a drink or snack, but nothing substantial. The pool is also in an odd location - it's in the courtyard of the hotel of the first floor, so the sun is limited and it's awkward because everyone in the hotel can see the pool from the lobby. Especially bad if you're there on business and want to sneak away - there's no way to do it because all of the meeting rooms are surrounding the pool. This hotel is off the strip, but right next to the monorail. You can take a short walk to the monorail and be on the strip in about 15 minutes. Personally, I prefer to be there. If you choose to take a cab, sometimes cabs are available and sometimes they are not. This is difficult because if you need to get someplace, and there's no cab, you have no choice but to wait. Overall, a good, clean hotel. I was not a fan of the location for my personal taste.

Reviews.Title: “Deteriorating”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: First stay here was uneventful. Second stay had issues. Management appears to be a revolving door with the only folks having longevity being the doormen and the valet's. Upon check in they charged my Visa (they deny this) in advance even though it wasn't a prepay rate. That caused a security trigger on my card. Hallways were filthy at a 3PM check in. See attached photo. On my floor alone there were 7 sets of food and dishes on the hall and there were flies in the hotel which is a little gross. Pool is really small and almost always in the shade and is viewable from the lobby. Not sure why they wouldn't frost the glass on at least the one lobby wall.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: BeemerPilot
Reviews.Content: great check in and concierge svc. friendly and helpful staff. QUIET. A quick trip to The Strip using the monorail's 3-day pass took us quickly and efficiently. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just far enough from the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: outof714
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend to enjoy a couples weekend. Chose hotel due to great internet promotion. Knew it was off the strip, but confident in the Renaissance brand. Hotel is small by Vegas standards, but very modern and clean. Could see it being a great hotel for conventioneers. It can be ghost town when there is no conference going on. Easy drive to strip and monorail station is not too far away. Parking was free (valet and self) Room was spacious and bathroom had a separate shower and tub. Walls are a bit thin as we heard occupants kids next door yelling and wresting. We enjoyed Envy for an afternoon snack and service was good. Calamari and flat bread was good. They had a wine tasting that was complimentary which was nice. Would not hesitate to stay again given an great rate.

Reviews.Title: “The only choice when working at Las Vegas Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: HobieKat
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Marriott is your best choice when attending trade shows at the Las Vegas Convention Center. It's steps from the south hall and allows quick trips back to your room or to grab a quick lunch. The best part is that it's not a casino. It's very relaxed, clean and upscale. The Envy steak house is perfect for client lunches and dinners as well. I would not recommend for families as the pool is small and in the shade most of the day. It's also a bit of a walk to the stirp. During busy conventions, the cab line here is far less than in front of the convention center or the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance hotel :/”
Reviews.Author: Nick0demus
Reviews.Content: This was a mixed bag experience! Although we had excellent first impressions of this modern and well equipped hotel we were very upset to learn that they did not offer free WIFI at all - it was $19.99 if we wanted 24 hours and be linked to our room's HD TV which I felt reasonable but they also wanted $13 fo 24 hours connection (per devise) if we'd brought our own smart phone or laptop :( come on guys - this is the 21st Century or are times really that bad?

Reviews.Title: “Not sure we'd stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: ShadyGrady
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice looking property. My wife had a convention so it's location was very convienent....right next to the LV conference center. And it was nice that it was not a casino, quiet. We stayed 3 nights. Unfortunately there were many things that were just not right. First of all we arrived at 11:15 a.m.. We did not expect to be able to check in so early. The check in lady was very nice. Timarra I believe. She told us to come back at 3 and see if our room was ready. After that, we stood in line for 20 minues to check our bags at the bell desk. One guy there to check in a long line with many people with many bags. At one point another bellman showed up and asked the lone bellman if he needed help. He declined, much to the disappointment of all of us standing in line that heard the offer. What was he thinking? We finally left our bags and went to the strip to check things out. We came back at 3:15 and stood in another long line to see if our room was ready. A gentleman named Yousef rather curtley and with a bit of arrogance said that our room was not ready yet. When asked when it would be, he told us to check back in awhile. No offer of a call or anything. In other words, stand in another long line to find out for the third time. Went back an hour later to find out that we could have 2 double beds now, but it would be "about" 2 hours more for a king siz bed. We took the doubles. Housekeeping is apparently a major issue with this property. They are seriously understaffed, especially for a not so big hotel. First of all the first day maid service hadn't been around by 4 p.m.. I went down the hall and asked the maid when she'd be by to clean our room. She said would clean it next. We left and by 5 it was cleaned. Then for 2 days in a row, she only left one wash cloth, even after having left a note for her to leave two the next day. I tried to call the front desk but the phone between the two beds didn't work! I didn't realize there were 2 phones in the room however. The other one worked. The bathroom floor was never mopped once the whole time. It was pretty obvious if you know what I mean. There was also a huge stain at the foot of one of the beds. They had a refridgerator and that was nice, but the rubber seal around the door was coming off so if you didn't push it back on the door it didn't keep things cool. We found out that one the hard way. We were there for almost 4 days and the 6th floor hallway carpets were never vacuumed once! I know this because I saw the same debris on the floor the last day that I saw on the first day. What's up with that? Then there's the pool. It's a nice small pool. Problem was that it was not clear...it was rather murky. You could see the bottom, but it was a little gamey looking for me to go swimming in. Too bad, since it was 108 and a swim would've been nice. I do have to say the bellman were very nice and very helpful. Most of the rest of the staff were also congenial. They also allowed a late check out time of 1:30 p.m. which was very nice since the convention didn't end until 12:45. Getting a cab to the airport was no problem and that was nice too. All in all, there are too many rooms in Vegas to put up with issues like these. I highly suggest management look into housekeeping staffing levels. They are not keeping up! It's too bad. I really wanted to like this property. Plus we're members of Marriott too. Hopefully management reads these and attends to these issues!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded most expectations. Great!”
Reviews.Author: travel_wahoo
Reviews.Content: This is the closest hotel to the Convention Center (adjacent to the parking lot) and its Monorail station, placing you just minutes to most Vegas strip attractions. The monorail entrance is about 300 meters from the hotel. A modern, stylish gem for Vegas, without all of the casino and 'resort' entrapments for your dollars. The nearest casino/resort is the Wynn, across the street. Rooms are modern/stylish with a very comfortable desk chair (great job, interiors people!) and comfy bed. The huge 50+" flatscreen had a good channel selection, and the modernized iBahn interactive setup was excellent and easy to use. My only beef was the in-room movie pricing: $9.99? My room had a small refrigerator as well as a lounging sofa, but this may not be a typical room. They advertise an evening turndown service, but that never happened during my stay. The bathroom was lit well, and had a separate tub and standing shower, with Aveda amenities, the standard for this brand. Not sure why other reviewers had issue here. No complaints at all: it's functional, modern, and though lacking some of the fancy, this is, again, not a "Resort", and not trying to be one. The internet had its slowish moments, as the hotel was fully booked the weekend I stayed, but it was wireless at least. If you are upgrading to one of the concierge floors, or have Marriott status, the lounge is on the 15th floor, with views of the north of the strip, and mountains. Foods here were nicer than typical Marriott lounges, and the staff is very attentive. The fitness center was equipped with bikes, treadmills, and ellipticals, as well as free weights, and some resistance equipment. About what I expect for this size hotel. If you need a larger / better gym, the front desk can recommend. The pool area was the only lacking part of the experience. It is in a courtyard arrangement (hotel surrounds it) meaning it gets sun only part of the day. The pool is also quite shallow, only up to 3.5 ft. Not a place to stay if you're expecting a lot of water time, that's where the nearby resorts do upstage this place. Also, the music was this awful smooth/relaxy/downtempo soundtrack that was often too loud. I had to have staff turn it down (twice) so I could hear my own. One benefit is that the pool is open evenings to cool off, while many other hotels close theirs at dusk. The whirlpool was popular, but the weather was too hot for me to sample it. Restaurant onsite is the "Envy" steakhouse, and quite good. The lounge's happy hour specials were quite competitive with anything on the strip, with an added bonus of being a more sedate and smoke-free environment to enjoy your relaxing cocktail. There is also a cafe for quick morning eats and coffee, if you do not have lounge access or don't wish to use the restaurant. All in all, you could do much worse in this town for the location and price. Certainly shop around, because if you want the resort experience, it can be had for the same pricing. This hotel is structured around the single business traveler or couples, not groups, and definitely not the kiddies (thank goodness!) It was refreshing to avoid all the resort hubbub, enjoy a nice conference center location, and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel...close to the monorail (quick walk thru the LV Convention Center). Nice not having a gambling hotel to stay in,”
Reviews.Author: OmgNice
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I did not find anything extremely wrong with the hotel. For the most part, it was beautiful and has fresh flowers in the lobby. You do have a little mini fridge in the rooms. We had a king room, with a gorgeous view (room 1410). While the say on their website says they have turn down service, we never experienced that. (Don't really care about it either, but if you want it, make sure they deliver). The staff if the friendliest I have encountered in quite a while. None of the rush of the strip hotels, which is very much appreciated. On Saturday, after the walk from the monorail to the hotel, we were quite thirsty and appreciated very much the bottled water that was brought out to us by the funny and working the entire taxi stand with a smile. And .... the daily refills of water in your mini fridge is Delightful!!! The only con I have about the hotel is that the room we were in needs to have the carpet replaced. There is a strip just outside the bathroom that needs replaced. Overall, very clean and friendly...we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “exceeds exceptions guests treated like a 5 Start hotel”
Reviews.Author: roark10
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to be helpful. As an example the lobby staff brought water to guests while they were waiting for a taxis. Something is really right with the management and staff - they do a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: B435
Reviews.Content: Nice room, but they did not clean it. They closed the pool early on a Saturday night. Close to convention center, but away from good dining. The staff were not sympathetic at all. It was an ok stay, but I would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KCMA79
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 5 day stay. I was looking for a quiet property without a casino that was close to the Convention Center. The Renaissance fit the bill perfectly. The room was large, modern and clean. The bathroom was large with a sep. tub and shower. Large plasma screen TV with many HD channels. The hotel is off the Strip but the monorail stop is just next door . It is a 5-10 min walk to the North Hall of the Convention Center. The staff was outstanding. They were always cordial and helpful. The only con is the limited venues for meals and a strangely limited menu. I did not try the Envy Steakhouse so that left the bar, room service or the Ego with prepackaged salads and sandwiches. The pool is also very small and is in the shade most of the day, not always a bad thing in the Las Vegas heat. But all in all I would stay here again with no qualms. Especially for an event at the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very nice staff. Room 1208 was great”
Reviews.Author: Cloud9west
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and were given Room 1208. We had a smashing view of the strip from our room. The room was nicely accomodated, a pretty large bathroom with separate glass enclosed shower and separate tub. I've read other reviews about cleanliness but ours was very clean. From check-in to housekeeping, every staff member we encountered was very friendly and wished us a pleasant day. It's a little thing but very appreciated. There was plenty of free parking (even on a holiday weekend). The location is excellent - just one long block from the strip and easy access to Paradise Road. It is right next to the monorail station which takes you all the way down the strip for $5 - saves you a ton of time parking or driving if you've had a cocktail. True, there is not much of a pool and the one restaurant and bar is expensive but it's Vegas and about 4 blocks down you can get $9.99 baby back ribs at Terrible's Casino that are really good (plus countless other restaurants all around you). All in all, I would recommend this hotel if you want easy in and out and want a break from the craziness of the strip and casino/hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place except for stained sheets, mildew in shower”
Reviews.Author: gr8ful2travel
Reviews.Content: Got the place for $80 on Priceline. Was impressed originally with lobby, check-in staff, room when you walked in. Things going well until bedtime when we pulled the sheet back and there was a brown stain - took 2 calls over 1/2 hour to get someone to change them. Then we noticed the bottom 6 inches of the shower corners were black with mildew. Thought we would eat breakfast but $13 oatmeal was too much - no wonder there were guests in the elevator with McDonalds bags! Wrote the hotel directly with these observations but 1 1/2 months later have heard nothing. They need to change their head of housekeeping because this is unaccepatble in a "4-5 star" property as they market themselves. I would stay again but look for these things and if present, get moved to another room until one was acceptable..

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: KeysLizard
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this facility and were quite disappointed. We were put in a room next to a utility room which constantly had an alarm going off. Each time Engineering was notified all they did was reset it the panel and subsequently the went off again within the hour. The shower drain in our bathroom was so clogged that we had to stop the shower to let it drain out some so as not to flood the bathroom and then finish showering. Also, the front desk kept answering the phone with "Hello Mr. (last name of registrant)" and it was not him on the phone. I found this to be quite annoying based on the number of calls that had to be made to front desk for the reasons explained above. The pool area only had about an hour of sun although the pool itself is heated. The high speed internet is quite expensive. The restaurant, Envy - The Steakhouse is completely overpriced. Over $60 for a steak and over $40 to add crab legs, $8.00 for a bagel. WOW !! Glad there was a VERY nice cafe within a 3 minute walk. We enjoyed our stay in Las Vegas but not necessarily this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: ctrueckert
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 1 night for $51. It was a nice hotel except for a couple of little things--double beds instead of queens, pool was totally in the shade by the time we checked in at 4 (which would be fine if it had been warmer) and hotel was a little too far away from the strip to walk and it was really annoying to get into the hotel because there is a median running down the street...so you had to go up the street and make a u turn to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff but hotel needs some upgrading”
Reviews.Author: lflone
Reviews.Content: My company has corporate rates with the Renaissance and two other properties in Las Vegas. On my recent trip to Las Vegas, I decided to stay at the Renaissance because it's one of the few hotels in Vegas that does not have a casino -which is a definite plus if you are lookign for a business decorum. The staff could not have been more pleasant, helpful and friendly - from the restaurant staff to the maids - always a hospitable smile and willingness to help in any way. I give the management great kudos for facilitating this level of service and attentiveness. The gym is excellent - great equipment and plenty of it. Lobby is nice, food is good and parking is free. The only drawback of this hotel was that the rooms are somewhat worn and dated. In my room, the handle handle to the sliding bathroom door was broken (hanging there, off the hinge), the door itself wouldn't slide closed and needed to be replaced, the refrigerator wasn't working and had to be replaced and the carpet was obviously worn and in desperate need of upgrading. I would and will stay at this hotel again, but I will ask for a more upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “hated at first no casino, later appriciated it!”
Reviews.Author: Pattislater
Reviews.Content: So I am here for business for a week. was dissapointed at first that the hotel was a non-gaming property. I am now glad as it is much more relaxing and I probablly saved a lot of money. It is right next to the convention center and the monorail which is $5.00 ow $12.00 unlimited for the day or $28 for 3 days. Is a short walk across a parking lot at the main entrance. 1 monorail stop to TI 2, to Flamingo 3, to bally's. Every 5 minutes. etc.The food here is very spendy! Coffee is $3.00 and pancakes are $11.00. They are putting in a espresso bar that they say will be open in 2 days from now. bed's comfy like most marriot property's. all in all it's not bad. Oh and one Con about this hotel is there is no free WIFI it's $12.95 daily from noon-noon.....that was a big deal for myself and my colleagues who were from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: oregon_lou
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for one day and one night, so we didn't spend too much time in our room. Initially, it appeared clean and tidy, but when I sat on the bed I noticed a stained comforter and small hairs on the white sheets. I'm not saying the bed wasn't clean, it looked it and smelled clean, but possibly they need to bleach or Oxi Clean their comforters more often and possibly use a lint roller to get anything on the sheets. They also did not vacuum the corners of the carpet (dust was very thick in the corner of the room by the bed) so all in all I wasn't surprised to hear a guest at the counter complaining that her room was "filthy". I wouldn't go as far as calling it a bad hotel, though. Location is VERY good- next to the rail. Also, the parking garage is free. We were allowed an early check in, which was nice, and also love the fact that it is non-smoking. We would return because of location and that it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Non-Gaming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xtina5150
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay in Vegas frequently, normally at our timeshare or a casino on the strip. This trip however we decided to book a room here after hearing from a few friends about this hotel. We were able to get a rate on priceline for $55.00 per night for both Friday and Saturday (which for Vegas on a weekend is unheard of). After reading other reviews I was a bit concerned about the paper thin walls but much to my surprise I had not one issue. The common areas of the hotel are beautiful and the staff was very friendly. Complimentary newspapers for your guests was a nice surprise also especially on Sunday morning. Although, we did not dine at the hotel we were impressed by smell coming from Envy and the coffee shop/snack area. I also liked the fact that the walk from the parking garage elevator was a short distance to the elevator that went to the hotel rooms. The room itself was nice. Comfortable bed, refrigerator, flat screen tv (nice channel selection), safe, etc...Our room overlooked the golf course at the Wynn (we were on the 11th floor) and our room was right across from the ice machine (no noise heard from that either) My husband and I both agreed we would definitly return for another stay. Whether you have a vehicle with you or not the monorail is right outside and can take you right to the strip. All in all I couldn't find anything wrong. We really enjoyed out stay!! Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable business hotel, yet not impressive.”
Reviews.Author: Martinzz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located off the Strip and does not have casino, which makes the clientele be almost exclusively business, no vacationers nor excited youngsters. Another positive moment is the location right next to the LV Convention Centre and a stone´s throw from the monorail, which will take you to the Strip in a matter of minutes. Now for the negatives: the room walls are paper-thin (I was actually woken up by a phone ringing in the neghbouring room), rooms themselves only have the amenities one would expect in this kind of place, but no detail distinguishing it from other like hotels. Moreover, my room had almost a 1/2´´ gap between the floor and the door, which caused a strong and noisy draft of cold air from the corridor to the room and had to be tamped with a towel. Another thing would be a daily charge for internet, which may be justified in a $40-a-night motel, but ridiculous in a business class hotel charging $150+ per night. Business center is also overpriced, $1.50 per b&w page printed is a rip-off. Nevertheless, this hotel is still acceptable, especially for those looking to escape the Strip frenzy and seeking proximity to the LVCC.

Reviews.Title: “Good non-casino hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: PeteyG_11
Reviews.Content: I wanted a quieter hotel this time and this was the best off the strip hotel I could find. It's right across the parking lot from the mono-rail so only a few minutes away to get to all the casinos. The pool is a bit small and in the shade half the day but I wasn't in Vegas for that so it didn't bother me. Food and drink is ok, of average hotel prices and the staff are friendly. Room was a good size and was clean. Bathroom also fine and nice quality toiletries. I'd recommend this for business travellers and it's right next door to the convention centre. However, probably not for those with families or wanting a good pool scene.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me....there are some problems with this otherwise okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Platinum member who stays at hotels 125 nights or more per year, I've seen great hotels, and good hotels, but this Renaissance barely achieves its brand status. The pluses: quiet room (they gave me a high floor, end of the hallway); HDTV with excellent selection of channels; generous room service portions and service; excellent fitness room equipment; very responsive "guest services" attendants, and free parking. Here are the areas that need to be improved: 1. Hotel Room -- inside the room, the comforter was dirty; the shower walls showing mold; no magnified mirror in the bathroom; no bath towel racks near the sink or shower; and 2. Housekeeping -- one of the days I was there, (despite leaving a chambermaid tip each day on the bed) housekeeping didn't leave full sets of towels; didn't replace soiled glasses with fresh ones and didn't clean the toilet !!!! (We should have packed up and walked out of the hotel -- there's NO excuse for a dirty toilet after the room is cleaned.) Also housekeeping should have removed the soiled/completed room service breakfast tray, but didn't. A quick call to "Guest Services" solved these problems quickly, but they shouldn't have happened in the first place. I did not try the hotel restaurant called Envy for dinner, but heard from others that it is quite good. Notwithstanding, although the Renaissance had the best price for 4-star hotels off The Strip, I'll stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: squareboy001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was gorgeous, clean and the staff was uber friendly. No casino smoke and noise, and so close to the strip by just using the monorail. I would recommend this hotel to everyone especially those needing to be near the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the conference center”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: if you are on business it is perfectly located rightvto the convention center. Does not have casino if you look for one. If you are the for pleasure i would not recommend it....far from the strip

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel convenient to the Convention Center and Monorail”
Reviews.Author: MikeSap
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Las Vegas is a beautiful, modern hotel with excellent service. While it does not offer a casino, it is convenient to the monorail, which will take you to the center of the action. It IS super convenient to the Convention Center.. so if you are coming to town for a show, this will save you lots of time. In addition to clean, comfortable, modern rooms, this hotel has a very good steakhouse and a superb room service selection.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL SURPRISE!”
Reviews.Author: Makanofuji
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Vegas with our three children and two of their close friends, arriving on Black Friday. Having heard about the hotel from a friend, we booked our rooms based primarily on the fact that the Renaissance is a non-smoking, casino-less property. The first thing you notice when you check in is the quiet and unpolluted surroundings. Having stayed several times on the Strip, it was at first a bit unnerving! Is no one staying here? The thoughts quickly faded as I realized that there were people everywhere. They were just all relaxing and unwinding in the spacious lounges and lobby area. This is a great start, I thought! The only unfortunate event was having to wait over an hour for the first room, and nearly three hours for the second. The hotel desk staff were absolutely professional and completely accommodating because`of this, and we were satisfactorily compensated for this inconvenience. I've always believed that sparkling, attentive service can overcome any distraction, and in Renaissance's case, that was more than apparent. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and QUIET! The mattresses were fantastic and there were plenty of soft pillows to prop yourself up to watch the 46" flat panel TV, if that happened to be your inclination! I don't know if this is a Vegas-wide issue, but the little reefer was basically a room temperature storage box. We had a big ice chest, so although we didn't need the reefer, it was still confusing why it was there at all. The coffee maker was one of those one-cup-at-a-time machines, which we used only for making hot water. Can't understand why they would get rid of the carafe, other than maybe for sanitary reasons. Internet service was available at $13 for 24-hour access, which seems to be the industry standard. We were just a five-minute walk from the Las Vegas Monorail, which was the best way to get to and from the Strip. Although there's plenty of free parking along the Strip, the 24-hour monorail pass at $9 per person was well worth the hassle of driving. Envy Steakhouse was our breakfast meeting place with our family and extended family and the options were as varied and they were delicious. No complaints here at all! Entrees were between $10-16, with an a' la carte section. The coffee, by the way, was outstanding, as was our hostess. Another huge plus was the free parking in an enclosed garage. A bit of an up-and-down ride on two elevators to get there, but not of any significance. The only other issue we had for the entire weekend, was that we were in no real rush to leave this peaceful hotel on our Sunday checkout day, that we ended up getting stuck in the infernal traffic leaving Vegas! After making the 40-mile trip to Primm in a little over two hours, and walking around the Outlet Mall for another two, we decided to head back to Vegas and try again the next morning. Our unexpected, extra night in Vegas was spent on the Strip at the Flamingo Hotel. Not bad, but if only I'd known about the third night free at the Renaissance, I would've made a beeline back there. Overall, I give the Renaissance my highest recommendation! Absolutely one of Vegas's best kept secrets!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful escape from Vegas mayhem”
Reviews.Author: caffy82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great because it didn't have a casino I had to fight my way through to get in or out of the hotel. It was also no-smoking, unlike the casinos, which smell of unpleasant cigarette smoke. The hotel interior was very attractive and self-parking in the attached car park was easy and free. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room itself was also very comfortable with a large impressive bathroom and free Aveda toiletries and tea and coffee. There was a happy hour with draft beer for a dollar. (You have to get a coupon from front desk). I didn't use the outdoor pool or jacuzzi/spa pool as it was too windy the days we were there, but the pool area looked very nice. We also had a meal at the Hotel restuarnt "Envy - the steakhouse" which was AMAZING. I would heartily recommend trying it. We both had superbly cooked fish dishes and enjoyed the house white wine. It is not on the strip - which is nice in some ways, but we kept having to go to meet our friends who were staying on the strip so ended up travelling a lot. Cab rides for a short distance take a while because of one way systems. One night my sleep was disturbed because the people in the next room were clearly in Vegas for the weekend - and made some noise which I could hear through the walls. But, I'm a light sleeper. It didn't bother my husband, who slept through it. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. Fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScarfGirl85
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was very clean and new with nice amenities. Although the exterior wasn't impressive, the lobby was quite nice. This would be a pleasant hotel for the business traveler who is looking to escape the Strip and spend time in a business hotel setting. If you are a casual traveler, the location is a bit of a hike to the Strip. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet and smokefree, but nothing to do!”
Reviews.Author: serenasun32
Reviews.Content: When I made my reservation I saw smoke free, but didn't notice there was no casino. I was excited about smoke free. Great pool and jacuzzi and open all the time. Room was nice, but housekeeping was another thing. They actually brought in more hair for the bathroom floor than I shed. Which was yucky! We stayed 4 days and didn't need housekeeping ,but wanted fresh towels, glasses etc. The notes didn't help. They kept doing everything each time, but not well. I clean houses for a living, so I notice this stuff. They appeared to just wipe out the shower each day and pretend to clean the floor. Towels etc did get changed though which was nice. Would I recommend yes, but it was a 15-20 min. walk to the Hilton in a sort of dark area to be walking at night in a construction zone. But overall it was nice and friendly staff. Valets were excellent as was the front desk people. Had to call security on our neighbors, but it was taken care of promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel enjoyed my stay but Needs wi-fi or free wi-fi connection in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adamgregory
Reviews.Content: Good hotel enjoyed my stay but Needs wi-fi or free wi-fi connection in the hotel. To get high scores. As a business hotel it needs to offer guests the wi-fi connection business travellers need.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to the monorail and a great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: chuckawala
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights and wanted off the strip. Pros: Excellent burger at the restaurant, breakfast and bar were fine. The gym was great, it was good sized for a hotel and overlooked the pool courtyard. The coffee bar served snacks and Illy cappuciono. Beds comfy, got a room overlooking the Wynn golf course.1/4 mile to monorail. Hotel uses a real nice spa 1 mile down the road. Cons:Small pool by Vegas standards. Next to convention center, so it is more of a business hotel versus a luxury resort. Staff lost my $50 Marriot coupon which they would not credit my account at check out. Finally they got it staright a few hours later and corrected billing.

Reviews.Title: “Great non-smoking, non-casino location off the strip, superb service”
Reviews.Author: Brenda3401
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a small group of friends or family who want a quiet location away from the large, noisy, smoke-filled casino hotels. Easy access to the strip via taxi or monorail. Our group of 18 women experienced wonderful attentive service throughout our stay. Very comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value through Hotels.Com”
Reviews.Author: Jackson6
Reviews.Content: We stayed several days and after much researching-found a great deal through Hotels.com The price was comparable to some of the older 2-Star hotels but the hotel is easily a 3.5 star. Rooms were clean and updated and housekeeping service was very friendly and accomodating. The desk staff were efficient and professional. Parking in the garage is free. Although it is off the Strip and we had to drive there, it was nice to come back at the end of the day without having to deal with smoke and the sounds of a casino in the background. It was quiet and relaxing. I'd stay there again for the same reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vodkasuntan
Reviews.Content: nice hotel perfect for confrence/exhibitions centre.. Clean rooms good size nothing amazing but to a good standard... room service good if back from work/shopping late.. would stay here again if working at the exhibitions centre.. easy access to the main strip

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Smoke-Free Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: xinotx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (a Saturday) and got the room for $65 on Priceline. I was pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was for $65 on a weekend night. The hotel structure, furniture and decor looks newer. There are no slot machines in this hotel and no smokey odor. The rooms were decorated with modern furniture, were good sized and comfortable. The bathroom was really nice, clean and had a separate tub and shower. We had a great view of the Stratosphere and northern end of the strip. We didn't want to take a cab or drink and drive so we walked a short distance to the monorail. It was late night and no one was hanging around or begging for money at the monorail station. We were a group of 3 adult females and 2 children and felt safe walking there. The cost of the monorail was $5 one way or $12 for a 24 hour unlimited pass. It drops you off to about 5 or 6 different hotels along the strip. My sister was disappointed in this hotel because she likes noise, lots of people, casinos/slot machines and smoking. When you're in the hotel lobby, you do not feel like you are in Vegas. I, however, really liked this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Beauty Away From the Hype”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on par with the Bellagio and Venetian, both of which I've stay at and noticed the same signs of wear and tear that you expect in any high traffic Vegas hotel. But, I thought the rooms were tastefully furnished and that housekeeping does a good job of upkeep and maintenance. I was truly surprised at how quiet the rooms were. Otherwise, there was nothing extraordinary about the property, but I will definitely stay herein the future when I want to get away from the hubbub of the strip and enjoy some peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good vaule”
Reviews.Author: Ron5078
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a few blocks from the strip and a little to far to walk but parking was availiable at the strip hotels for free. Hotel was clean and easy to get too. Has a full breakfast with the price which was excellent. The only things that was a little odd they have no ice machines. I did asked the desk and they went to the kitchen to get some for us for our drinks. Don't drink the water from the bottles in the room unless you intend to pay for them. I found that out when I got back home and I was billed for them. There not free!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fairly comfortable stay and great location too!”
Reviews.Author: DesertFlowerNM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance two nights and the stay was fairly comfortable, clean and conveniently located. The beds were alright, not the best I've slept in though. The pool was very small, but the pool area is very comfortable with lots of padded lounge chairs. the fitness center was great with many different options to choose from. Room was clean with attention paid to details which I appreciate. Housekeeping was fast and efficient. What I didn't like was that the staff didn't seem to know much about the hotel itself. I require a fridge for my insulin, and when I asked for one to be sent up I was told they were sold out. They gave me an option of storing my insulin in the hotel fridge which would have been fine, but I didn't really want to chance that. Hubby got our little cooler from the car and filled it with ice for my insulin. However, when we were checking out scouring the room for forgotten items, I discovered the fridge (and a safe) hiding under the television in a small cupboard. Wasn't happy that the staff failed to let us know about it being there thus possibly saving us some hassle. One big plus is that it is located very conveniently to the monorail, so travel to the wild strip area was simple. This hotel is not a casino and is very family friendly (except the out of control guests at the pool shouting obscenities over and over unchecked by the staff). Overall a nice place to stay and one I would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance”
Reviews.Author: deikerm
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for a long weekend to help celebrate a friend's birthday. Rather than staying on "the strip", we decided on the Renaissance, due to good reviews, reasonable prices, free parking, and proximity to the monorail (which would get us to and from our various events.) The hotel is located right next to the Convention Center. There were no events going on there, so the property was quiet and very relaxing -- great for us after all the crowds! The entire property was elegant, with tasteful modern decor. The room was spacious, comfortable, and lovely, and we enjoyed time in the fitness center and around the pool -- shared with only a few people. We highly recommend this property for those who come to Vegas for a more relaxing and less crowded time!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: cocolinu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week. Pros: *Super cheap priceline rate 55$/night *On the monorail route *Close to grocery,etc. (by foot or by car) *Clean'ish *Comfortable *Walk-in shower (my fiance loves that) *Nice pool and jacuzzi *Free parking Cons: *4 small empty bottles of vodka UNDERNEATH our mattress from the previous guests *Inside of bed frame dusty, covered in hairs (not mine that's for sure) *Extra small bedsheets for a king bed *So-so sleeping pillows *Overheating mini fridge *Finger smudges on the ceiling of the washroom (what happened in there???) *Small and crowded pool, especially on the weekend *Super thin walls with super noisy neighbors most of our stay *Dirty garage and no security cameras, especially by the elevator *Foot prints on the ceiling of the garage (???) *Chipped pain on the inside of the walk-in shower Overall, if I could get the cheap rate again, I would stay here again, but will complain if I ever found something to not be okay (like some the above mentioned issues) in my room again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Discriminated Against”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: One problem after the next this time. Room type incorrect. Service was terrible, hotel not staffed adequately. General Manager was very apologetic and assured me no more problems until denied valet parking for no reason. Front desk declined to contact manager. I will never sell or recommend this hotel as it has been blacklisted among my 2200 agents.

Reviews.Title: “Property on a downhill fall.”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshortOhio
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times and the property seems to be showing a lot of wear .I love Renaissance as a general rule but this location is just average.It is located on the monorail line away from the noise of the strip but this property has super loud doors so beware of slams and thin, thin walls. The streets around the hotel are unsafe so do not walk alone at night. The staff at front desk was nice , bellstaff friendly and the food is super! Starbucks is also here.If you are at a convention this is a good location. Beds and linens are very good quality. Smoking area is at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Hideaway from the Vegas Craziness”
Reviews.Author: lcraig59
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Vegas for the past 25 years, like many, all of it for conventions at the LVCC and Sands Expo. It goes without saying I'm qualified to review a hotel here. This is my first stay at the Renaissance and it will be my home away from home, from here on out. Like other reviewers, this is not the place to stay if you want the full Vegas "experience." It's not marketed that way, anyway, as it's adjacent to the LVCC. What you'll get is a peaceful, clean, quite room with the Marriott class service and "look" of their properties for business travelers. Pluses: Huge room and bathroom (separate glass shower), and the microfridge. It's a plus out here, considering the $$$$ you pay for a bottle of Coke at the casino gift shops elsewhere. Tip: Provision up before you check in, or find a way to go shopping for snacks and drinks. The fridge is a big plus out here ... I haven't experienced the "noise" others have noted, only during day with housekeeping. Internet service, no problem either. It's an easy 10 minute walk to the North Hall, about the same walking time as the Hilton. Less the fact there's an Elvis Tribute convention there now ... again, another reason to stay here. Service is excellent, due in part to the fact it's a smaller property and thus, a higher staff/guest relation factor. You certainly cannot possibly get that at the bigger hotels around here. Even so, there's a monorail station at the convention center, giving you the convenience of going to the Strip if need be. I reserved a "mid floor" room and got it, including a nice view of the Wynn Golf course across the street. Green is an added amenity here, amid this concrete/asphalt jungle, so it's nice to see the greenery separating me from the strip hotels. I've had co-workers staying at the Hilton who've already said they're moving here for future conventions ... we're all here for conventions. Makes sense to have a place to relax and chill, less having to pass through the casino zoo, wait on elevators, all of it, next door at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Canes428
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel went above and beyond. Everything was amazing - although my friends and I weren't looking for the typical "crazy" Las Vegas vacation, so someone who is looking for a 24/7 party should probably not stay here. It was a little bit off the strip (not far) with a small pool that never got crowded, which was a plus for us. I paid less than $90.00 a night, and was very satisfied with the room quality, location, and price. The bathroom was amazing, too! We may have been woken up a few times, but it's Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: TRB710625
Reviews.Content: The staff was A+ in customer service, from the bellmen at the front door to the check in counter to the room service folks. I really enjoyed my stay here this June 2010. The location is close to the airport (10-15 minute shuttle ride). It is not located on The Strip, so getting around is quite tricky. If you don't rent a car, there's a monorail which shuffles nearby. This monorail is a $12.00 pass for the whole day to travel back & forth. I used this monorail for the entire day, it stops a various hotels along the strip and you can exit and walk where you need to. Plus, this hotel has an award winning restaurant called "ENVY" (a bit on the pricy side)...but you get a good meal, plus the staff goes above and beyond. TIPS: When you arrive at the airport, BEWARE of the cab drivers!! My driver gave me two options: the long way or the cheap way!!! Of course, I wanted to more reasonable way (who doesn't !!). Since the hotel is 10-15 minutes away from the airport he took the "freeway" and went around and around to get to the hotel, milking every 0.50cents he could from me. I ended up paying $30.00 when I exited his cab!! This realisticly should have been a $15.00 cab ride. THE BEST THING TO DO: There are hotel shuttles which no one hears about!!! FIND THEM!! They stop at each hotel along the strip or others along the way! Once you exit the airport, they're located in the arrival area where those 'dreaded' cab drivers are nearby. CHOOSE THESE HOTEL VANS!!! It's a total of $7.00 for a drop off!!!! What a major money saving tip!!! I used a company called "BELL TRANS" when departing that day to go home. The hotel concierge called Bell Trans for me to pick me up that morning for my flight. They arrived promptly, and $7.00 later I was at airport for my flight! DO YOURSELF A FAVOR...DO NOT TAKE THE LOCAL CAB DRIVERS!!! THEY WILL RIP YOU OFF!!! Plus since the hotels don't have their own shuttle vans for this, they normally don't advertise them. I found out the hard way! USE these shuttle vans going to your hotel when you arrive and returning back to the airport when you depart!

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for something smaller and off strip then it is a good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tcouncil
Reviews.Content: Decided on a one night last minute Vegas trip and everything on the strip was priced ridiculously high. As a result I decided to look up Marriott chains because I stay there frequently and found this hotel for $149 for a Saturday night. The hotel itself is quite nice, has a pool. It is off strip a couple blocks behind the major strip hotels. It has a pool, restaurant, etc. If you don't want to stay on the strip then this is a really good choice. The staff, however, could have been a little friendlier throughout the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, next to the LV Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: deeann622
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at this hotel. When you have to be in Las Vegas for work or want to get away from the madness of the strip, this is the hotel. NO SMOKING, NO GAMING. The hotel staff was so pleasant and accommodating. It was the first time for my business associates staying at this hotel and they were so impressed that this is now their first choice to stay in Vegas. I arrived a bit early so I made my way to the restaurant and had a burger. The burger hit the spot. The rooms has all the modern ammenities and beds were comfortable. We initially had a problem connecting with the internet service, but Matt helped us out and from that point the internet service worked perfectly. There is a kiosk in the lobby to check in for your flight and print your boarding pass. We ordered room service one night and it was probably the best room service I've ever had. In my opinion, it topped the room service that I have had at 5 star hotels. Truffle fries, truffle fries, truffle fries. Salad with the salmon and goddess dressing was excellent too. The food was delivered by Jade and she was so sweet to answer all of our questions with directions etc. We had such a positive experience that my business associates asked to be included for future travels to this hotel. Other notes: Monorail is conveniently located a short distance. So if you want to go to the strip, its accesible. The food at Envy steakhouse is outstanding. Ego Cafe - morning coffee, small was about $2.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Dog
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel through Priceline, I knew about the odd location, lack of casino, etc. In fact, it was those things that made me want to book this hotel. I had a 5 a.m. flight from Chicago and arrived at the hotel at 10 a.m. The very kind clerk took pity upon me and allowed me to check in early so I could nap before retrieving my mom from the airport. I specifically requested a quiet room. Additionally, I only stayed here one night - a Saturday night. I, however, did not experience any of the noise issues other guests had. My room was very quiet and comfortable. I liked the Aveda toiletries, the very comfortable beds and the cleanliness of the hotel. I was bothered by the stains on the carpet and bedskirts in my room. I would never, ever have stains on my bedskirt at home. I feel like something so small should be attended to before guests arrive at the room. IMO, it just shows a lack of care for the rooms and the guests who stay in those rooms. Other than that, the room was clean, quiet, comfortable and perfectly decent. I would stay here if I received a good deal on Priceline, i.e. $60 per night. That being said, I would never pay the rack room rate for this room. There are much better deals to be had in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Even if OFF the Strip”
Reviews.Author: gdlstx
Reviews.Content: LOCATION- This hotel is indeed OFF the strip, but that does not pose a problem at all. The hotel is located near the convention center which is very near to the monorail stop. You can get to and from the strip in a new york minute. OR if you have your own vehicle, this makes it even easier as all hotels on the strip offer free parking. STAFF- Extremely pleasant when arriving, during the stay, and at checkout. I'm not surprised though... excellent customer service is typical of the Marriott/Renaissance brand. ROOMS- Excellent rooms. Size, cleanliness, and comfort level all receive multiple thumbs up. I really liked this hotel and have returned a few times since my first stay. Because it's off the strip, it doesn't feel any less like Vegas. In fact, I actually prefer it.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant experience”
Reviews.Author: Ashwini
Reviews.Content: I had a wunderful expereince during my stay in this hotel, i think this hotel deserves a 5 star rating, i got a excellent deal from priceline for about $58-65 per night. This hotel is 100% non-smoking and i got a room on 9th floor with a strip view, it was amazing..... The hotel is not that far from strip also, i used to take my car on stip...parked in TI one day and Tropicana the other day... I will definetely stay in this hotel in future... The only thing i didn't like were --- Internet is not free --- whenever my neigbhor opened his door, it sounded its mine

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you don't want the "Vegas" experience.”
Reviews.Author: MrEricG
Reviews.Content: This review is based on two stays at the Renaissance in March of 2010. For starters, I'm 33 and I don't look forward to trips to Las Vegas. I've been out there a lot. I used to enjoy it, but it's gotten really old for me. I've stayed in places from the Excalibur and MGM Grand up to the Venetian and Mirage, and a lot of places in between. (And once upon a time, I even stayed at the Sahara.) To be fair, I have enjoyed many of these properties. I just don't get excited about Vegas anymore. These days, I travel to Las Vegas 2 -3 times per year for business. On rare occasions, my wife and I take a brief vacation there. On my business trips, I have stayed at a number of Strip properties, but I tried the Renaissance for my most recent two trips and likely will continue to stay here on future trips. As many other reviewers have noted, the Renaissance is not on the Strip. Therefore, if you're looking for the full Vegas experience, you won't like it here. This is a business hotel located next to the Convention Center. Set your expectations accordingly. The hotel has a reasonably good restaurant -- ENVY the steakhouse -- and a convenient cafe/newsstand just behind the lobby. There is also a lobby bar just off of the lobby before you get to ENVY. The hotel has a pool in a narrow, center courtyard-like area, but I never saw the sun shining on it -- it was always in the shadow of the sides of the hotel. No need to bring a swimsuit here. You're far more likely to sit poolside in your clothes after a long day at the Convention Center. The business services are fairly standard. There is a business center with three computer workstations and individual printers. (It is free to print your boarding passes here.) Internet access is available in the rooms, but they only have wired Internet access, and that for a price. Wi-Fi should be standard these days. It's 2010. My rooms were clean with the standard appointments. Coffee makers are included, which is always nice. I had one maintenance issue (a slow-draining shower). I mentioned it at the front desk on my way to dinner and it was fixed when I came back.
